Distributed Storage for Intermittent Energy Sources Control Design and Performance Limits Ya shod han Kano ria Andrea Montana ri David Tse Bao sen Zhang Stanford University Berkeley October Abstract One of the most important challenges in the integration of renewable energy sources into the power grid lies in their intermittent nature The power output of sources like wind and solar varies with time and location due to factors that cannot be controlled by the provider Two strategies have been proposed to hedge against this variability use energy storage systems to eec iv ely average the produced power over time exploit distributed generation to eec iv ely average production over location We introduce network model to study the optimal use of storage and transmission resources in the presence of random energy sources We propose Linear Quadratic based methodology to design control strategies and we show that these strategies are asymptotically optimal for some simple network topologies For these topologies the dependence of optimal performance on storage and transmission capacity is explicitly quan tied

OPTIMAL CONTROL WITH RESET RENEWABLE RESOURCES TAKEI CHEN CLAWS ON KIROV AND VLADIMIR SKY Abstract We consider both discrete and continuous control problems constrained by ed budget of some resource which may be renewed upon entering preferred subset of the state space In the discrete case we consider both deterministic and stochastic shortest path problems on graphs with full budget reset in all preferred nodes In the continuous case we derive augmented DEs of optimal control which are then solved numerically on the extended state space with full instantaneous budget reset on the preferred subset We introduce an iterative algorithm for solving these problems cie ntl The methods performance is demonstrated on range of computational examples including optimal path planning with constraints on prolonged visibility by static enemy observer In addition we also develop an algorithm that works on the original state space to solve related but simpler problem ding the subsets of the domain reachable within the budget This manuscript is an extended version of the paper accepted for publication by SIAM on Control and Optimization In the journal version Section and the Appendix were omitted due to space limitations Section

Renewal Theoretical Dynamic Spectrum Access in Cognitive Radio Networks with Unknown Primary Behavior Chun xiao Jiang Yan Chen Ray Liu and Yong Ren Department of Electrical and Computer Engineering University of Maryland College Park MD USA Department of Electronic Engineering Tsinghua University Beijing China mail cx yan jr liu umd edu re ny thu edu cn Abstract Dynamic spectrum access in cognitive radio networks can greatly improve the spectrum utilization efc ien cy Nevertheless interference may be introduced to the Primary User PU when the Secondary Users SUs dynamically utilize the PUs licensed channels If the SUs can be synchronous with the PUs time slots the interference is mainly due to their imperfect spectrum sensing of the primary channel However if the SUs have no knowledge about the PUs exact communication mechanism additional interference may occur In this paper we propose dynamic spectrum access protocol for the SUs confronting with unknown primary behavior and study the interference caused by their dynamic access Through analyzing the SUs dynamic behavior in the primary channel which is modeled as an ON OFF process we prove that the SUs communication behavior is renewal process Based on the Renewal Theory we quantify the interference caused by the SUs and derive the corresponding close form expressions With the interference analysis we study how to optimize the SUs performance under the constraints of the PUs communication quality of service Qo and the secondary networks stability Finally simulation results are shown to verify the effectiveness of our analysis Index Terms Cognitive radio dynamic spectrum access interference analysis renewal theory October DRAFT

Large deviations of ergo dic counting processes statistical mechanics approach Adrian Bud in Consejo Nacional de Invest iga ci ones Cie nt cas Tec nica Centro Atomic Bari loc he Avenida Bu still Km Bari loc he Argentina Dated September The large deviation method allows to characterize an ergo dic counting process in terms of thermodynamic frame where free energy function determines the asymptotic non stationary st ti st ical properties of its uc tu at ions Here we study this formalism through statistical mechanics approach with an auxiliary counting process that maximizes an entropy function associated to the thermodynamic potential We show that the realization of this auxiliary process can be obtained after applying conditional measurement scheme to the original ones providing is this way an alternative measurement interpretation of the thermodynamic approach General results are obtained for renewal counting processes those where the time intervals between consecutive events are independent and de ned by unique waiting time distribution The underlying statistical mechanics is controlled by the same waiting time distribution re scaled by an exponential decay me sure by the free energy function scale in variance shift closure and inter mitten ce phenomena are obtained and interpreted in this context Similar conclusions apply for non renewal processes when the memory between successive events is induced by stochastic waiting time distribution PAC numbers Ln Lc

Low Power Dynamic Scheduling for Computing Systems Michael Neely Abstract This paper considers energy aware control for computing system with two states active and idle In the active state the controller chooses to perform single task using one of multiple task processing modes The controller then saves energy by choosing an amount of time for the system to be idle These decisions affect processing time energy expenditure and an abstract attribute vector that can be used to model other criteria of interest such as processing quality or distortion The goal is to optimize time average system performance Applications of this model include smart phone that makes energy efc ent computation and transmission decisions computer that processes tasks subject to rate quality and power constraints and smart grid energy manager that allocates resources in reaction to time varying energy price The solution methodology of this paper uses the theory of optimization for renewal systems developed in our previous work This paper is written in tutorial form and develops the main concepts of the theory using several detailed examples It also highlights the relationship between online dynamic optimization and linear fractional programming Finally it provides exercises to help the reader learn the main concepts and apply them to their own optimization This paper is an ar xiv technical report and is preliminary version of material that will appear as book chapter in an upcoming book on green communications and networking Index Terms Queueing analysis optimization stochastic control renewal theory

Direct competition results from strong competition for limited resource Sep deh Mir rahim Be not Per thame Joe Yu ichiro Waka no February Abstract We study model of competition for resource through che most at type model where species consume the common resource that is constantly supplied We assume that the species and resources are characterized by continuous trait As already proved this model although more complicated than the usual Lot ka Volterra direct competition model describes competitive interactions leading to concentrated distributions of species in continuous trait space Here we assume very fast dynamics for the supply of the resource and fast dynamics for death and uptake rates In this regime we show that factors that are independent of the resource com petition become as important as the competition ec ien cy and that the direct competition model is good approximation of the che most at Assuming these two timescales allows us to establish mathematically rigorous proof showing that our resource competition model with continuous traits converges to direct competition model We also show that the two timescales assumption is required to mathematically justify the corresponding classic result on model consisting of only nite number of species and resources MacArthur The or Pop ul Bio This is performed through asymptotic analysis introducing die rent scales for the resource renewal rate and the uptake rate The mathematical di cult relies in possible initial layer for the resource dynamics The che most at model comes with global convex Lyapunov functional We show that the particular form of the competition kernel derived from the uptake kernel satis es positiv it property which is known to be necessary for the direct competition model to enjoy the related Lyapunov functional Key Words Ecological competition for resource Direct competition Multi scale analysis Lyapunov functional Adaptive dynamics Mathematics Subject Classic ation

Functional limit theorems for renewal shot noise processes with increasing response functions Alexander ksa nov November Abstract We consider renewal shot noise processes with response functions which are eventually non decreasing and regularly varying at inn it We prove weak convergence of renewal shot noise processes properly normalized and centered in the space under the or topology The limiting processes are either spectral ly non positive stable Levy processes in clu ding the Brownian motion or inverse stable sub or dina tors when the response function is slowly varying or fractionally integrated stable processes or fractionally integrated inverse stable sub or dina tors when the index of regular variation is positive The proof exploits ne properties of renewal processes distribution al properties of stable Levy processes and the continuous mapping theorem Keywords continuous mapping theorem fractionally integrated inverse stable process fun ional limit theorem topology renewal shot noise process spectral ly negative stable process

Decentralized Delay Optimal Control for Interference Networks with Limited Renewable Energy Storage Huang Huang Member IEEE Vincent Lau Fellow IEEE Abstract In this paper we consider delay minimization for interference networks with renewable energy source where the transmission power of node comes from both the conventional utility power AC power and the renewable energy source We assume the transmission power of each node is function of the local channel state local data queue state and local energy queue state only In turn we consider two delay optimization formulations namely the decentralized partially observable Markov decision process DEC POM DP and Non cooperative partially observable stochastic game POS In DEC POM DP formulation we derive decentralized online learning algorithm to determine the control actions and Lagrangian multipliers LMs simultaneously based on the policy gradient approach Under some mild technical conditions the proposed decentralized policy gradient algorithm converges almost surely to local optimal solution On the other hand in the non cooperative POS formulation the transmitter nodes are non cooperative We extend the decentralized policy gradient solution and establish the technical proof for almost sure convergence of the learning algorithms In both cases the solutions are very robust to model variations Finally the delay performance of the proposed solutions are compared with conventional baseline schemes for interference networks and it is illustrated that substantial delay performance gain and energy savings can be achieved The authors are with the Department of Electronic and Computer Engineering ECE HongKong University of Science and Technology HK UST Hong Kong May DRAFT

SOME CHARACTERIZATIONS OF MIXED RENEWAL PROCESSES Ly be ro poul os and Mac her as November lm Abstract Some characterizations of mixed renewal processes in terms of exchange ability and of die rent types of disintegration are given As consequence an ex is ten ce result for mixed renewal processes providing also new construction for them is obtained As an application some concrete examples of constructing such processes are presented and the corresponding disintegrating measures are explicitly computed MSC Primary secondary Key Words mixed renewal process disintegration product regular conditional probability sub el regular conditional probability exchange ability

An asses semen of global energy resource economic potentials Jean Francois Mercure Pablo Sal as Cambridge Centre for Climate Change Mitigation Research MR Department of Land Economy University of Cambridge Silver Street Cambridge CB EP United Kingdom Abstract This paper presents an assessment of global economic energy potentials for all major natural energy resources This work is based on both an extensive literature review and calculations using natural resource assessment data Economic potentials are presented in the form of cost supply curves in terms of energy ow for renewable energy sources or ed amounts for fossil and nuclear resources with strong emphasis on uncertainty using consistent methodology that allow direct comparisons to be made In order to interpolate through available resource assessment data and associated uncertainty theoretical framework and computational methodology are given based on statistical properties of die rent types of resources jus tied empirically by the data and used throughout This work aims to provide global database for natural energy resources ready to integrate into models of energy systems enabling to introduce at the sametime uncertainty over natural resource assessments The supplementary material provides theoretical details and tables of data and parameters that enable this extensive database to be adapted to variety of energy systems modelling frameworks Keywords Global energy resources Climate change mitigation Economic Potential Renewable Energy Fossil Fuels

Mechanism Designs for Stochastic Resources for Renewable Energy Integration Wen yuan Tang Rah ul Jain Department of Electrical Engineering University of Southern California wen yuan rah ul jain usc edu Abstract Among the many challenges of integrating renewable energy sources into the existing power grid is the challenge of integrating renewable energy generators into the power systems economy Electricity markets currently are run in way that participating generators must supply contracted amounts And yet renewable energy generators such as wind power generators cannot supply contracted amounts with certainty Thus alternative market architectures must be considered where there are aggregator entities who participate in the electricity market by buying power from the renewable energy generators and assuming risk of any shortfall from contracted amounts In this paper we propose auction mechanisms that can be used by the aggregator for procuring stochastic resources such as wind power The nature of stochastic resources is different from classical resources in that such resource is only available stochastic ally The distribution of the generation is private information and the system objective is to truthfully elicit such information We introduce variant of the VC mechanism for this problem We also propose non VC mechanism with contracted payment plus penalty payoff structure We generalize the basic mechanisms in various ways We then consider the setting where there are two classes of players to demonstrate the if cult of auction design in such scenarios We also consider an alternative architecture where the generators need to full any shortfall from the contracted amount by buying from the spot market Keywords Renewable energy integration smart grid mechanism design stochastic resource auction The second authors research on this project is supported by the NSF CAREER award CNS and an IBM Faculty Award June DRAFT

The Annals of Probability Vol No DOI OP cid Institute of Mathematical Statistics SEMI MARKOV APPROACH TO CONTINUOUS TIME RANDOM WALK LIMIT PROCESSES By Mark Meer sch ert and Peter St raka Michigan State University and NSW Australia Continuous time random walks CT RWs are versatile models for anomalous diu sion processes that have found widespread ap pli cation in the quantitative sciences Their scaling limits are ty pi call non Markov ian and the computation of their nite dimensional distributions is an important open problem This paper develops general semi Markov theory for CT RW limit processes in Rd with inn it ely many particle jumps renewals in nite time intervals The particle jumps and waiting times can be coupled and vary with space and time By augmenting the state space to include the scaling lim its of renewal times CT RW limit process can be embedded in Markov process Explicit analytic expressions for the transition ker nels of these Markov processes are then derived which allow the computation of all nite dimensional distributions for CT RW limits Two examples illustrate the proposed method

Nu RER III International Conference on Nuclear Renewable Energy Resources stanbul TURKEY May PROVISIONAL STUDY OF ADS WITHIN TURKIC ACCELERATOR COMPLEX PROJECT Arik Bil in Cal is kan Ceti ner Sultan soy Bog az ici University Istanbul Turkey TO BB University of Economics and Technology Ankara Turkey Ka stam on University Ka stam on Turkey Institute of Physics of AN AS Baku Azerbaijan Abstract The Turkic Accelerator Complex TAC project has been developed with the support of the Turkish State Planning Organization by the collaboration of Turkish universities The complex is planned to have four main facilities namely AS EL Facility Based on GeV Electron Lina Third Generation Synchrotron Radiation Facility SR Based on GeV Positron Synchrotron Super Charm Factory GeV by colliding the electron beam coming from the lina with an energy of GeV and positron beam coming through the positron ring with an energy of GeV GeV scale proton accelerator Later has two fold goal Neutron pall ation Source NSS and ADS The proton accelerator construction will have MeV MeV and GeV phases The technical design report is planned to be finished in Since Turkey has essential Thorium reserves the ADS becomes very attractive for our country as emerging energy technology Keywords ADS proton accelerator Thorium Turkey TAC

Mining Event Logs to Support Work flow Resource Allocation Tin gyu Liu along Cheng Zhong hua Ni School of Mechanical Engineering Southeast University Nanjing China Jiangsu Key Laboratory for Design and Manufacture of Micro Nano Biomedical Instruments Southeast University Nanjing China mail addresses ty liu live com Liu cheng along seu gmail com Cheng zh seu edu cn Ni Abstract Currently work flow technology is widely used to facilitate the working process in enterprise information systems IS and it has the potential to reduce design time enhance product quality and decrease product cost However significant limitations still exist as an important task in the context of work flow many present resource allocation operations are still performed manually which are time consuming This paper presents data mining approach to address the resource allocation problem RAP and improve the productivity of work flow resource management Specifically an priori like algorithm is used to find the frequent patterns from the event log and association rules are generated according to predefined resource allocation constraints Subsequently correlation measure named lift is utilized to annotate the negatively correlated resource allocation rules for resource reservation Finally the rules are ranked using the confidence measures as resource allocation rules Comparative experiments are performed using SV ID Nave Bayes and the presented approach and the results show that the presented approach is effective in both accuracy and candidate resource recommendations Keywords work flow resource allocation data mining process mining association rules

Multi State Model for the Reliability Assessment of Distributed Generation System via Universal Generating Function Yan fu Li Enrico Zio Ecole Centrale Paris Su pele Paris France yan fu li cp fr yan fu li su pele fr enrico zio cp fr enrico zio su pele fr Polite nico di Milano Milan Italy Di parti men to di ner gia Enrico zio poli mi it Abstract The current and future developments of electric power systems are pushing the boundaries of reliability assessment to consider distribution networks with renewable generators Given the stochastic features of these elements most modeling approaches rely on Monte Carlo simulation The computational costs associated to the simulation approach force to treating mostly small sized systems with limited number of lumped components of given renewable technology wind or solar etc whose behavior is described by binary state working or failed In this paper we propose an analytical multi state modeling approach for the reliability assessment of distributed generation The approach allows looking to number of diverse energy generation technologies distributed on the system Multiple states are used to describe the randomness in the generation units due to the stochastic nature of the generation sources and of the mechanical degradation failure behavior of the generation systems The universal generating function GF technique is used for the individual component multi state modeling multiplication type composition operator is introduced to combine the GFs for the mechanical degradation and renewable generation source states into the GF of the renewable generator power output The overall multi state system GF is then constructed and classical reliability indices loss of load expectation LOL expected energy not supplied EEN are computed from the system generation and load GFs An application of the model is shown on system adapted from the IEEE nodes distribution test feeder Key Words Distributed generation reliability assessment multi state modeling universal generating function

Non parametric estimation of renewal reward process from discrete data Celine Duval Abstract We study the non parametric estimation of the jump density of re new al reward process from one discrete ly observed sample path over We consider the regime when the sampling rate as The main di cult is that renewal reward process is not Levy process the increments are non stationary and dependent We propose an adaptive wavelet threshold density estimator and study its performance for the loss over Be sov spaces We achieve mini max rates of convergence for sampling rate sT that vanish with at polynomial rate In the same spirit as Buch mann and rubel and Duval the estimation procedure is based on the in version of the compounding operator The inverse has no closed form expression and is approached with axed point technique AMS subject classic at ions Keywords Renewal reward process Continuous time random walk Com pound Poisson process Discrete ly observed random process Wavelet density estimation

International Journal on Cloud Computing Services and Architecture IJ CCS Vol No June Efficient Resource Allocation in Resource provisioning policies over Resource Cloud Communication Paradigm Gaur av Raj An kit is chal As st Prof Lovely Professional University er gaur av raj gmail com Tech Student Lovely Professional University Pha gwar is chal an kit hotmail com Abstract Optimal resource utilization for executing tasks within the cloud is one of the biggest challenges In executing the task over cloud the resource provision er is responsible for providing the resources to create virtual machines To utilize the resources optimal ly the resource provision er has to take care of the process of allocating resources to Virtual Machine Manager MM In this paper an efficient way to utilize the resources within the cloud to create virtual machines has been proposed considering optimum cost based on performance factor This performance factor depends upon the overall cost of the resource communication channel cost reliability and popularity factor We have proposed framework for communication between resource owner and cloud using Resource Cloud Communication Paradigm CCP We extend the CloudS im adding provision er policies and Efficient Resource Allocation ERA algorithm in MM allocation policy as decision support for resource provision er Keywords Cloud Computing Resource Provision er Virtual Machine Manager Broker Cloud Communication Paradigm

The Global Grid Spyro sChatz vasil eia is Damien Ernst Goran Andersson Power Systems Laboratory ETH Zurich Zurich Switzerland Institut Monte ore University of Lie ge Lie ge Belgium Abstract This paper puts forward the vision that natural future stage of the electricity network could be grid spanning the whole planet and connecting most of the large powerplants in the world this is the Global Grid The main driving force behind the Global Grid will be the harvesting of remote renewable sources and its key infrastructure element will be the high capacity long transmission lines Wind farms and solar powerplants will supply load centers with green power overlong distances This paper focuses on the introduction of the concept showing that globally interconnected network can be technologically feasible and economically competitive We further highlight the multiple opportunities emerging from global electricity network such as smoothing the renewable energy supply and electricity demand reducing the need for bulk storage and reducing the volatility of the energy prices We also discuss possible investment mechanisms and operating schemes Among others we envision in such system global power market and the establishment of two new coordinating bodies the Global Regulator and the Global System Operator Keywords global electricity grid electricity transmission network global electrical network renewable energy wind power solar power

CONDITIONS FOR RATIONAL WEAK MIXING JON AARONS ON Abstract We exhibit rationally ergo dic spectral ly weakly mix ing measure preserving transformations which are not sub sequence rationally weakly mixing and give condition for smoothness of re new al sequences Weak mixing in in nite ergo dic theory The classical weak mixing theorem breaks down for conservative ergo dic transformations preserving in nite measures see of However Th in for conservative ergo dic measure pre serving transformation of nite measure space the following conditions are equivalent is constant ii is ergo dic ergo dic probability preserving iii Xu Tk mn uL Well call measure preserving transformation satisfying any one of them spectral ly weakly mixing This is in the interest of disambiguation as other notions of weak mixing are also considered here In and elsewhere spectral weak mixing is called weak mixing stronger notion was introduced in in The conservative ergo dic measure preserving transformation is called rationally weakly mixing along KN if so that AT kB uk an nK BF Mathematics Subject Classic ation The authors research was partially supported by Israel Science Foundation grant No The author would like to thank the University of Surrey for hospitality provided when this paper was written

On the global economic potentials and marginal costs of non renewable resources and the price of energy commodities Jean Francois Mercure Pablo Sal as Cambridge Centre for Climate Change Mitigation Research MR Department of Land Economy University of Cambridge Silver Street Cambridge CB EP United Kingdom Abstract model is presented in this work for simulating endogenous ly the evolution of the marginal costs of production of energy carriers from non renewable resources their consumption depletion pathways and timescales Such marginal costs can be used to simulate the long term average price formation of energy commodities Drawing on previous work where global database of energy resource economic potentials was constructed this work uses cost distributions of non renewable resources in order to evaluate global ow of energy commodities mathematical framework is given to calculate endogenous ow of energy resources given an exogenous commodity price path This framework can be used in reverse in order to calculate an exogenous marginal cost of production of energy carriers given an exogenous carrier demand Using rigid price inelastic assumptions independent of the economy these two approaches generate limiting scenarios that depict extreme use of natural resources This is useful to characterise the current state and possible uses of remaining non renewable resources such as fossil fuels and natural uranium The theory is however designed for use within economic or technology models that allow technology substitutions In this work it is implemented in the global power sector model FT Power Policy implications are given Keywords Energy price forecasting Fossil fuel depletion Energy systems modelling

THE FORCE OF TSUNAMI ON WAVE ENERGY CONVERTER LAURA BRIEN PAUL CHRISTO DO ULI DES EMILIANO REN ZI DENYS DUTY KH AND FREDERIC DIAS Abstract With an increasing emphasis on renewable energy resources wave power technology is fast becoming realistic solution However the recent tsunami in Japan was harsh reminder of the ferocity of the ocean It is known that tsunamis are nearly undetectable in the open ocean but as the wave approaches the shore its energy is com pressed creating large destructive waves The question posed here is whether near shore wave energy converter WEC could withstand the force of an incoming tsunami The analytical model of Ren zi Dias developed within the framework of linear theory and applied to an array of ed plates is used The time derivative of the velocity potential allows the hydro dynamic force to be calculated Contents

Quantum ness in the context of Resource Theories Micha oro deck and Jonathan Oppenheim Institute for Theoretical Physics and Astrophysics University of Gdansk Gdansk Poland National Quantum Information Centre of Gdansk Sopot Poland Department of Physics and Astronomy University College London London United Kingdom Dated September Were view the basic idea behind resource theories where we quantify quantum resources by spec if ying restricted class of operations This divides the state space into various sets including states which are free because they can be created under the class of operations and those which are are source because they cannot be One can quantify the worth of the resource by the relative entropy distance to the set of free states and under certain conditions this is unique measure which quan ties the rate of state to state transitions The framework includes entanglement asymmetry and purity theory It also includes thermodynamics which is hybrid resource theory combining purity theory and asymmetry Another hybrid resource theory which merges purity theory and entangle ment can be used to study quantum ness of correlations and discord and we present quantum ness in this more general framework of resource theories

Cascade Failures from Distributed Generation in Power Grids Antonio Scala Sak shi Pa hwa and Caterina cog lio IS CNR Physics Dept Un iv La pienza Piazza le Moro Roma Italy IMT Alt Studi Lucca piazza Ponzi no Lucca Italy London Institute of Mathematical Sciences South Audley St Mayfair London NY UK Department of Electrical and Computer Engineering College of Engineering Kansas State University Manhattan KS Abstract Power grids are nowadays experiencing transformation due to the introduction of Distributed Generation based on Renewable Sources At die rence with classical Distributed Generation where local power sources mitigate anomalous user consumption peaks Renewable Sources introduce in the grid intrinsically erratic power inputs By introducing simple schematic but realistic model for power grids with stochastic distributed generation we study the eec ts of erratic sources on the ro bust ness of several IEEE power grid test networks with up to buses We nd that increasing the penetration of erratic sources causes the grid to fail with sharp transition We compare such results with the case of failures caused by the natural increasing power demand Keywords distributed generation DC power model cascading failures rst order transition

CHANCE CONSTRAINED OPTIMAL POWER FLOW RISK AWARE NETWORK CONTROL UNDER UNCERTAINTY DANIEL BIEN STOCK MICHAEL CHERT KOV AND SEAN HARNETT Abstract When uncontrollable resources uc tu ate Optimum Power Flow OP routinely used by the electric power industry tore dispatch hourly controllable generation coal gas and hy dr plants over control areas of transmission networks can result ingrid instability and potentially cascading outages This risk arises because OP dispatch is computed without awareness of major uncertainty in particular uc tu at ions in renewable output As result grid operation under OP with renewable variability can lead to frequent conditions where power line ow ratings are sign cant ly exceeded Such condition which is borne by simulations of real grids would likely resulting in automatic line tripping to protect lines from thermal stress risky and undesirable outcome which compromises stability Smart grid goals include commitment to large penetration of highly uc tua ting renewables thus calling to reconsider current practices in particular the use of standard OP Our Chance Constrained CC OP corrects the problem and mitigates dangerous renewable uc tu at ions with minimal changes in the current operational procedure Assuming availability of reliable wind forecast parameter zing the distribution function of the uncertain generation our CC PFs at is es all the constraints with high probability while simultaneously minimizing the cost of economic re dispatch CC OP allows ec ent implementation solving typical instance over the bus Polish network in seconds on standard laptop Key words Optimization Power Flows Uncertainty Wind Farms Networks The power grid can be considered one of the greatest engineering achievements of the th century responsible for the economic well being social development and resulting political stability of billions of people around the globe The grid is able to deliver on these goals with only occasional disruptions through sign cant control sophistication and careful long term planning Nevertheless the grid is under growing stress and the premise of secure electrical power delivered anywhere and at any time may become less certain Even though utilities have massively invested in infrastructure grid failures in the form of large scale power outages occur un predictably and with increasing frequency In general automatic grid control and regulatory statutes achieve robustness of operation as conditions display normal uc tu at ions in particular approximately predicted inter day trends in demand or even unexpected single points of failure such as the failure of generator or tripping of single line However larger unexpected disturbances can prove quite di cult to overcome This di cult can be explained by the fact that automatic controls found in the grid are largely of an engineering nature the wheel directed generator response used to handle short term demand changes locally and are largely not of data driven algorithmic and distributed nature Instead should an unusual condition arise current grid operation relies on human input Additionally only some real time data is actually used by the grid to respond to evolving conditions All engineer in gelds can be expected to change as computing becomes evermore enmeshed into operations and massive amounts of real time data become available Department of Industrial Engineering and Operations Research and Department of Applied Physics and Applied Mathematics Columbia University West th St New York NY USA da no columbia edu Theoretical Division and Limit theorems for renewal shot noise processes with decreasing response functions Alexander ksa nov Alexander Mary nyc and Matthias Mein ers April Abstract We consider shot noise processes with deterministic re pons function and the shots occurring at the renewal epochs of zero delayed renewal process We prove con ver gence of the nite dimensional distributions of ut as in die rent regimes If the response function is directly Riemann in te grable then the nite dimensional distributions of ut converge weakly as Neither scaling nor centering are needed in this case If the response function is eventually decreasing non in te grable with an in te grable power then after suitable shifting the nite dimensional distributions of the process converge Again no scaling is needed In both cases the limit is den tied If the distribution of is in the domain of attraction of an stable law and the response function is regularly varying at with index with or depending on whether ES or ES then scaling is needed to obtain weak convergence of the nite dimensional distributions of ut The limits are fractionally integrated stable Levy motions if ES and fractionally integrated inverse stable sub or dina tors if ES Mathematics Subject Classic ation Primary Secondary Keywords nite dimensional convergence fractionally integrated stable Levy motion fractionally integrated inverse stable sub or in at or renewal shot noise process Faculty of Cybernetics National Shevchenko University of Kyiv Kyiv Ukraine mail ik san un iv kiev Faculty of Cybernetics National Shevchenko University of Kyiv Kyiv Ukraine mail mary nyc un icy kiev Institut fur Ma them at is cheSt at is tik West fal is che Wilhelm Universitat Munster Munster Germany mail mme in ers math uni mu nster de

Network Risk Limiting Dispatch Optimal Control and Price of Uncertainty Bao sen Zhang Student Member IEEE Ram Raja gopal Member IEEE David Tse Fellow IEEE Abstract Increased uncertainty due to high penetration of renewables imposes sign cant costs to the system operators The added costs depend on several factors including market design performance of renewable generation forecasting and the spec ic dispatch procedure Quantifying these costs has been limited to small sample Monte Carlo approaches applied spec ic dispatch algorithms The computational complexity and accuracy of these approaches has limited the understanding of tradeoffs between different factors In this work we consider two stage stochastic economic dispatch problem Our goal is to provide an analytical quant cation and an intuitive understanding of the effects of uncertainties and network congestion on the dispatch procedure and the optimal cost We rst consider an un congested network and calculate the risk limiting dispatch In addition we derive the price of uncertainty number that characterizes the intrinsic impact of uncertainty on the integration cost of renewables Then we extend the results to network where one link can become congested Under mild conditions we calculate price of uncertainty even in this case We show that risk limiting dispatch is given by set of deterministic equilibrium equations The dispatch solution yields an important insight congested links do not create isolated nodes even in two node network In fact the network can support back ow in congested links that are useful to reduce the uncertainty by averaging supply across the network We demonstrate the performance of our approach in standard IEEE benchmark networks

Accepted for publication in IEEE Wireless Communications Letters Copyright transferred to IEEE Physical Layer Secured Key Distribution Technique for IEEE Wireless Networks Marco Bald Marco Bianchi Nicola Matur Franco Chiara luce II Universit Polite nica delle Marche Ancona Italy Email bald bianchi matur chiara luce un iv pm it Abstract Key distribution and renewing in wireless local area networks is crucial issue to guarantee that unauthorized users are prevented from accessing the network In this paper we propose technique for allowing an automatic bootstrap and periodic renewing of the network key by exploiting physical layer security principles that is the inherent differences among transmission channels The proposed technique is based on scrambling of groups of consecutive packets and does not need the use of an initial authentication nor automatic repeat request protocols We present mo dication of the scrambling circuits included in the IEEE standard which allows for suitable error propagation at the unauthorized receiver thus achieving physical layer security Index Terms IEEE key distribution physical layer security scrambling wireless networks

USE OF BEST EST PROCEDURE TO IMPROVE BUILDING THERMAL SIMULATION PROGRAM SO BD HAN MARA BOYER and YOU NES Universit Antilles Guy ne partement de Physique BP Pointe Pit re cede Guadeloupe France Labor to ire de nie In dust riel Equip nie Civil avenue Ren Cassin BP Saint Denis Mess ag Cede La union France email mara un iv reunion fr ABSTRACT Validation of building energy simulation programs is of major interest to both users and mode ller To achieve such task it is essential to apply methodology based on priori test and empirical validation priori test consists in verifying that models embedded in program and their implementation are correct this should be achieved before carrying out experiments The aim of this report is to present results from the application of the BEST EST procedure to our code We will emphasise the way it allows to find bugs in our program and also how it permits to qualify models of heat transfer by conduction KEYWORDS Building energy simulation validation BEST EST inter program comparison DESCRIPTION BEST EST procedure The International Energy Agency IEA sponsors number of programs to improve the use and associated technologies of energy The National Renewable Energy Laboratory NREL developed BEST EST Jud off Neymar which is method based on comparative testing of building simulation programs on the IEA's behalf The procedure consists of series of test cases buildings that are designed to isolate individual aspects of building energy and test the extremes of program As the modelling approach is very different between codes the test cases are specified so that input equivalency can be defined thus allowing the different cases to be modelled by most of codes The basis for comparison is range of results from number of programs considered to be state of art in United States and Europe CODY RUN In Reunion Island we developed for both design and research purposes multi model and multi zone building energy simulation software called CODY RUN Boyer et al Indeed one of the most interesting aspects of this code is to propose different models of heat transfer Models of heat transfer by conduction through walls are based on thermal and electrical analogy It is possible to choose between the simplified model only two nodes by wall or more disc ret zed one the number of nodes depends on the number of layers in the wall

Incorporating learning goals about modeling into an upper division physics laboratory experiment Benjamin wick Noah Finkel stein and Lewandowski Department of Physics University of Colorado Boulder Boulder CO Dated October Abstract Implementing laboratory activity involves complex interplay among learning goals available resources feedback about the existing course best practices for teaching and an overall philosophy about teaching labs Building on our previous work which described process of transforming an entire lab course we now turn our attention to how an individual lab activity on the polarization of light was redesigned to include renewed emphasis on one broad learning goal modeling By using this common optics lab as concrete case study of broadly applicable approach we highlight many aspects of the activity development and show how modeling was used to integrate sophisticated conceptual and quantitative reasoning into the experimental process through the various aspects of modeling constructing models making predictions interpreting data comparing measurements with predictions and re ning models One sign cant outcome is natural way to integrate an analysis and discussion of systematic error into lab activity

Energy Cooperation in Cellular Networks with Renewable Powered Base Stations Yeo Kh ang Chia Su mei Sun and Rui Zhang Abstract In this paper we propose model for energy cooperation between cellular base stations BS with individual hybrid power supplies including both the conventional grid and renewable energy sources limited energy storages and connected by resistive power lines for energy sharing When the renewable energy role and energy demand role at all BS are deterministic or known ahead of time we show that the optimal energy cooperation policy for the BS can be found by solving linear program We show the be nets of energy cooperation in this regime When the renewable energy and demand roles are stochastic and only causally known at the BS we propose an online energy cooperation algorithm and show the optimal it properties of this algorithm under certain conditions Furthermore the energy saving performances of the developed of in and online algorithms are compared by simulations and the effect of the availability of energy state information ES on the performance gains of the BS energy cooperation is investigated Finally we propose hybrid algorithm that can incorporate of in information about the energy roles but operates in an online manner Index Terms Energy cooperation energy harvesting hybrid power supply cellular networks stochastic optimization

Survey on Array Storage Query Languages and Systems Florin Rusu Yu Cheng University of California Merced Lake Road Merced CA rusu cheng uc merced edu February Abstract Since sci en tic investigation is one of the most important providers of massive amounts of ordered data there is renewed interest in array data processing in the context of Big Data To the best of our knowledge unie resource that summarizes and analyzes array processing research over its long existence is currently missing In this survey we provide guide for past present and future research in array processing The survey is organized along three main topics Array storage discusses all the aspects related to array partitioning into chunks The ident cation of reduced set of array operators to form the foundation for an array query language is analyzed across multiple such proposals Lastly we survey real systems for array processing The result is thorough survey on array data storage and processing that should be consulted by anyone interested in this research topic independent of experience level The survey is not complete though We greatly appreciate pointers towards any work we might have forgotten to mention

LARGE DEVIATION PRINCIPLES FOR WORDS DRAWN FROM CORRELATED LETTER SEQUENCES DEN HOLLANDER AND PO IS AT Abstract When an sequence of letters is cut into words according to renewal times ani sequence of words is obtained In the annealed LDP large deviation principle for the empirical process of words the rate function is the spec ic relative entropy of the observed law of words the reference law of words In Birk ner Greven and den Holl an der the quenched LDP conditional on atypical letter sequence was derived for the case where the renewal times have an algebraic tail The rate function turned out to be sum of two terms one being the annealed rate function the other being proportional to the spec ic relative entropy of the observed law of letters the reference law of letters obtained by concatenating the words and random ising the location of the origin The proportionality constant equals the tail exponent of the renewal process The purpose of the present paper is to extend both LDP to letter sequences that are not It is shown that both LDP carry over when the letter sequence satis es mixing condition called sum mable variation The rate functions are again given by spec ic relative entr opie the reference law of words respectively letters But since neither of these reference laws is several approximation arguments are needed to obtain the extension MSC Key words Letters and words renewal times empirical process annealed vs quenched large deviation principle rate function spec ic relative entropy mixing Acknowledgment dH and JP were supported by ER Advanced Grant VAR IS

Renewal processes based on generalized Mit tagLe fer waiting times Dexter ahoy Federico Poli to Department of Mathematics and Statistics College of Engineering and Science Louisiana Tech University USA Tel fax Email address dc ahoy late ch edu Department of Mathematics University of Torino Italy Tel fax Email address federico poli to uni to it Corresponding author October Abstract The fractional Poisson process has recently attracted experts from several lds of study Its natural generalization of the ordinary Poisson process made the model more appealing for real world applications In this paper we generalized the standard and fractional Poisson processes through the waiting time distribution and showed their relations to an integral operator with generalized Mit tagLe fer function in the kernel The waiting times of the proposed renewal processes have the generalized Mit tagLe fer and stretched squashed Mit tagLe fer distributions Note that the generalizations naturally provide greater ex bil it yin modeling real life renewal processes Algorithms to simulate sample paths and to estimate the model parameters are derived Note also that these procedures are necessary to make these models more usable in practice State probabilities and other qualitative or quantitative features of the models are also discussed Keywords Fractional Poisson process generalized Mit tagLe fer distribution renewal processes Pra bha kar operator

concatenations of words from some nite generating list This simple den it ion hides surprisingly rich structure that is in many ways independent of the usual topological and dynamical structure of the shift space The present work was motivated by the following problem raised by Adler Is every irreducible shift of nite type conjugate to renewal system Several attempts have been made to answer this question and the con ju gacy of certain special classes of renewal systems is well understood but there exist only few results concerning the general problem This work is the rst to investigate the corresponding question for ow equivalence The aim has been to nd the range of the Bowen Franks invariant over renewal systems of nite type and several classes of renewal systems displaying wide range of values of the invariant are constructed but it remains unknown whether renewal systems can attain all the values attained by irreducible shifts of nite type Section gives an introduction to shift spaces and renewal systems Section concerns the left Fischer covers of renewal systems and gives conditions under which the Fischer covers of complicated renewal systems can be constructed from simpler building blocks with known presentations Section gives ow class cation of class of renewal systems introduced in while Sec uses the results of the previous two sections to construct classes of RUIN PROBABILITIES FOR RISK PROCESSES WITH NON STATIONARY ARRIVALS AND SUB EXPONENTIAL CLAIMS LING JI ONG ZHU Abstract In this paper we obtain the nite horizon and in nite horizon ruin probability asymptotic for risk processes with claims of sub exponential tails for non stationary arrival processes that satisfy large deviation principle As result the arrival process can be dependent non stationary and non renewal We give three examples of non stationary and non renewal point processes Hawkes process Cox process with shot noise intensity and self correcting point process We also show some aggregate claims results for these three examples

Renewal theory for random walks on surface groups Peter Has in sky Pierre Mathieu and Sebastian ller August Abstract We construct renewal structure for random walks on surface groups The renewal times are de ned as times when the random walks enters particular type of cone and never leaves it again As consequence the trajectory of the random walk can be expressed as an aligned union of trajectories between the renewal times Once having established this renewal structure we prove central limit the orem for the distance to the origin under exponential moment conditions Analytic it of the speed and of the asymptotic variance are natural consequences of our approach Furthermore our method applies to groups with inn it ely many ends and therefore generalizes classic results on central limit theorems on free groups Keywords renewal theory surface groups central limit theorem analytic it AMS Mathematics Subject Classification

Semi Markov model for market micro structure Pietro ODRA Huy en PHAM Labor to ire de Pro babi lites et Labor to ire de Pro babi lites et Mod les Alea to res Mod les Alea to res CNRS MR CNRS MR Universit Paris Diderot Universit Paris Diderot and EX QI pham math un iv paris diderot fr pietro odra gmail com CREST EN SAE and Institute Ho Chi Minh City May Abstract We introduce new model for describing the uc tu at ions of tick by tick single asset price Our model is based on Markov renewal processes We consider point process associated to the time stamps of the price jumps and marks associated to price increments By modeling the marks with suitable Markov chain we can reproduce the strong mean reversion of price returns known as micro structure noise Moreover by using Markov renewal processes we can model the presence of spikes in intensity of market activity the volatility clustering and consider dependence between price increments and jump times We also provide simple parametric and non parametric statistical procedures for the estimation of our model We obtain closed form formula for the mean signature plot and show the diu sive behavior of our model at large scale limit We illustrate our results by numerical simulations and nd that our model is consistent with empirical data on the Eu rib or future Keywords Micro structure noise Markov renewal process Signature plot Scaling limit Tick by tick observation from to during on the front future contract Eu rib or

Risk Limiting Dispatch with Ram ping Constraints Junji Qin Bao sen Zhang Ram Raja gopal IC ME EEC CEE Stanford University University of California Berkeley Stanford University Stanford CA Berkeley CA Stanford CA Email qin stanford edu Email zhang bao eec berkeley edu Email ram stanford edu Abstract The increased penetration of renewable resources poses challenge to reliable operation of power systems In particular operators face the risk of not scheduling enough traditional generators in the times when renewable generation becomes lower than expected This paper studies the optimal trade off between system risk and the cost of scheduling reserve generators The problem is modeled as multi period stochastic control problem and in particular explicitly considering the ram ping constraints on the generators The structure of the optimal dispatch control is den tied Dispatch is efc ent ly computed utilizing two methods solving surrogate chance constrained program ii MPC type look ahead controller Utilizing real system data the chance constrained dispatch is shown to outperform the MPC controller and to be robust to changes in the probability distribution of the uncertainties involved in the problem

MULTI FRACTAL TUBES Lars Olsen Department of Mathematics University of St Andrews St Andrews Fife KY Scotland mail lo st and ac uk Abstract Tube formulas refer to the study of volumes of neighbourhoods of sets For sets satisfying some possible very weak convexity conditions this has long history However within the past years Lap id ushas initiated and pioneered systematic study of tube formulas for fractal sets Following this it is natural to ask to what extend it is possible to develop theory of multi fractal tube formulas for multi fractal measures In this paper we propose and develop framework for such theory Firstly we de ne multi fractal tube formulas and more generally multi fractal tube measures for general multi fractal measures Secondly we introduce and develop two approaches for analysing these concepts for self similar multi fractal measures namely Multi fractal tubes of self similar measures and renewal theory Using techniques from renewal theory we give complete description of the asymptotic behaviour of the multi fractal tube formulas and tube measures of self similar measures satisfying the Open Set Condition Multi fractal tubes of self similar measures and zeta functions Unfortunately renewal the or techniques do not yield explicit expressions for the functions describing the asymptotic behaviour of the multi fractal tube formulas and tube measures of self similar measures This is clearly undesirable For this reason we introduce and develop second framework for studying multi fractal tube formulas of self similar measures This approach is based on multi fractal zeta functions and allow us obtain explicit expressions for the multi fractal tube formulas of self similar measures namely using the Mell in transform and the residue theorem we are able to express the multi fractal tube formulas as sums involving the residues of the zeta function Mathematics Subject Classic ation Keywords and phrases Self similar measures multi fractals Minkowski dimension Re nyi dimension multi fractal spectrum tube formulas tube measures the renewal equation complex dimensions zeta functions

Dominant Resource Fairness in Cloud Computing Systems with Heterogeneous Servers Wei Wang Bao chun Li Ben Liang Department of Electrical and Computer Engineering University of Toronto Abstract We study the multi resource allocation problem in TABLE cloud computing systems where the resource pool is constructed CONFIGURATIONS OF SERVERS IN ONE OF GOOGLE CLUSTERS from large number of heterogeneous servers representing CPU AND MEMORY UNITS ARE NORMALIZED TO THE MAXIMUM SERVER different points in the cong ration space of resources such as HIGHLIGHTED BELOW processing memory and storage We design multi resource Number of servers CPUs Memory allocation mechanism called DR FH that generalizes the notion of Dominant Resource Fairness DR from single server to multiple heterogeneous servers DR FH provides number of highly desirable properties With DR FH no user prefers the allocation of another user no one can improve its allocation without decreasing that of the others and more importantly no user has an incentive to lie about its resource demand As direct application we design simple heuristic that implements DR FH in real world systems Large scale simulations driven by Google cluster traces show that DR FH sign cant ly outperforms the traditional slot based scheduler leading to much higher resource utilization with substantially shorter job completion times of different resources The system then allocates resources to users at the granularity of these slots Such single resource abstraction ignores the heterogeneity of both server

and Biotechnology University of Milan Milan Italy Abstract Background fundamental problem in cancer research is identifying the cell type that is capable of sustaining neo plastic growth and its origin from normal tissue cells Recent investigations of variety of tumor types have shown that phenotypic ally identifiable and is ol able sub fractions of cells possess the tumor forming ability In the present paper using two lineage related human melanoma cell lines primary melanoma line GR and its metastatic derivative line GR two main observations are reported The first one is the first phenotypic evidence to support the origin of melanoma cancer stem cells CSC from mutated tissue specific stem cells and the second one is the identification of more aggressive sub population of CSC in melanoma that are CX CR Methods Findings We defined CX CR as new bio marker for tissue specific stem cell asymmetric self renewal Thus the relationship between melanoma formation and ABC and CX CR expression was investigated Consistent with their non metastatic character un sorted GR cells formed significantly smaller tumors than un sorted GR cells In addition ABC cells produced tumors that had fold greater mass than tumors produced by un sorted cells or ABC cells CX CR cells produced more aggressive tumors CX CR identifies more discrete sub population of cultured human melanoma cells with more aggressive MCS phenotype than cells selected on the basis of the ABC phenotype alone Conclusions Significance The association of more aggressive tumor phenotype with asymmetric self renewal phenotype reveals previously unrecognized aspect of tumor cell physiology Namely the retention of some tissue specific stem cell attributes like the ability to asymmetrically self renew impacts the Cl on al selection and therapy resistance in acute leukemias Mathematical modelling explains die rent proliferation patterns at diagnosis and relapse Thomas tie hl Natalia Baran Anthony Ho and Anna Marcin ak Cz och ra Institute of Applied Mathematics BIO QUANT and WR University of Heidelberg Im Neue he mer Fe ld Heidelberg Germany Department of Medicine University of Heidelberg Im Neue he mer Fe ld Heidelberg Germany Published in Soc Interface doi rs if ABSTRACT Recent experimental evidence suggests that acute myeloid leukemias may orig nate from multiple clones of malignant cells Nevertheless it is not known how the observed clones may die with respect to cell properties such as proliferation and self renewal There are scarcely any data on how these cell properties change due to chemotherapy and relapse We propose new mathematical model to investigate the impact of cell properties on multi cl on al composition of leukemias Model result simply that enhanced self renewal may be key mechanism in the cl on al selection process Simulations suggest that fast proliferating and highly self renewing cells dominate at primary diagnosis while relapse following therapy induced remission is triggered mostly by highly self renewing but slowly proliferating cells Comparison of simulation results to patient data demonstrates that the proposed model is consistent with clinically ob served dynamics based on cl on al selection process Keywords cl on al evolution leukemia cancer stem cells mathematical models se lec tion process

Joint Optimization of Hybrid Energy Storage and Generation Capacity with Renewable Energy Peng Yang Student Member IEEE and rye Neh orai Fellow IEEE Abstract In an isolated power grid or micro grid with small carbon footprint the penetration of renewable energy is usually high In such power grids energy storage is important to guarantee an uninterrupted and stable power supply for end users Different types of energy storage have different characteristics including their round tripe fci en cy power and energy rating energy loss over time and investment and maintenance costs In addition the load characteristics and availability of different types of renewable energy sources vary in different geographic regions and at different times of year Therefore joint capacity optimization for multiple types of energy storage and generation is important when designing this type of power systems In this paper we formulate cost minimization problem for storage and generation planning considering both the initial investment cost and operational maintenance cost and propose distributed optimization framework to overcome the if cult brought about by the large size of the optimization problem The results will help in making decisions on energy storage and generation capacity planning in future decentralized power grids with high renewable penetrations Index Terms energy storage Phase asymmetry resource inter conversion via estimation Va run Narasimha char and Gila our Institute for Quantum Science and Technology University of Calgary University Drive NW Calgary Alberta Canada Department of Physics and Astronomy University of Calgary University Drive NW Calgary Alberta Canada Department of Mathematics and Statistics University of Calgary University Drive NW Calgary Alberta Canada Dated August Practical implementations of quantum information theoretic applications rely on phase co her en ces between systems These coherence are disturbed by misalignment between phase references Quantum states carrying phase asymmetry act as resources to counteract this misalignment In this paper we construct protocols for inter converting these resources by rst estimating the mis align ment Our method achieves sub linear but otherwise arbitrarily high asymptotic rate of conversion of pure resource states to mixed ones No other method is known for asymptotic pure to mixed state conversion Our method also has the advantage of achieving phase reference alignment in addition to resource conversion

quenched large deviation principle in continuous scenario Birk ner den Hollander th December Abstract We prove the analogue for continuous space time of the quenched LDP derived in Birk ner Greven and den Hollander for discrete space time In particular we consider random environment given by Brownian increments cut into pieces according to an independent continuous time renewal process We look at the empirical process obtained by recording both the length of and the increments in the successive pieces For the case where the renewal time distribution has Le be gue density with polynomial tail we derive the quenched LDP for the empirical process the LDP conditional on typical environment The rate function is sum of two spec ic relative entr opie one for the pieces and one for the concatenation of the pieces We also obtain quenched LDP when the tail decays faster than algebraic The proof uses coarse raining and truncation arguments involving various approximations of spec ic relative entr opie that are not quite standard In companion paper we show how the quenched LDP and the techniques developed in the present paper can be applied to obtain variation al character is ation of the free energy and the phase transition line for the Brownian copolymer near selective interface MSC Keywords Brownian environment renewal process annealed vs quenched empirical pro ces large deviation principle spec ic relative entropy Acknowledgment The research in this paper is supported byE RC Advanced Grant VAR IS ofF dH MB is grateful for hospitality at the Mathematical Institute in Leiden dur ing sabbatical leave from September until February supported by ER

RUMOR PROCESSES ON AND DISCRETE RENEWAL PROCESSES SANDRO GALLO NANCY GARCIA VAL DIVINO VARGAS JUNIOR AND PABLO RODRIGUEZ Abstract We study two rumor processes on the dynamics of which are related to an SI epidemic model with long range transmission Both models start with one spreader at site and ignorant at all the other sites of but die by the transmission mechanism In one model the spreaders transmit the information within random distance on their right and in the other the ignorant stake the information from spreader within random distance on their left We obtain the probability of survival information on the distribution of the range of the rumor and limit theorems for the proportion of spreaders The key step of our proofs is to show that in each model the position of the spreaders on can be related to suitably chosen discrete renewal process

EP manuscript No will be inserted by the editor Space use by foragers consuming renewable resources Guillermo Abrams on Marcelo Kuper man Juan Morales and Joel Miller Centro Atomic Bari loc he CONIC ET and Instituto Bal sei ro deBar ilo che Argentina Lab oratorio Eco to no IN IBI OMA CONIC ET and Universidad Nacional del Coma hue de Bari loc he Argentina Department of Biology Pennsylvania State University Pennsylvania USA Received date Revised version date Abstract We study simple model of forager as walk that mo dies relaxing substrate Within it simplicity this provides an insight on number of relevant and non intuitive facts Even without memory of the good places to feed and no explicit cost of moving we observe the emergence of nite home range We characterize the walks and the use of resources in several statistical ways involving the behavior of the average used fraction of the system the length of the cycles followed by the walkers and the frequency of visits to plants Preliminary results on population eec ts are explored by means of system of two non directly interacting animals Properties of the overlap of home ranges show the existence of set of parameters that provides the best utilization of the shared resource PAC Cc Population dynamics and ecological pattern formation General theory and mathematical aspects

Journal of Art ici al Intelligence Research Submitted published Resource Driven Mission Phasing Techniques for Constrained Agents in Stochastic Environments Jian hui Wu jian hui umich edu Edmund Dur fee dur fee umich edu Computer Science and Engineering University of Michigan Ann Arbor MI USA Abstract Because an agents resources dictate what actions it can possibly take it should plan which resources it holds over time carefully considering its inherent limitations such as power or payload restrictions the competing needs of other agents for the same resources and the stochastic nature of the environment Such agents can in general achieve more of their objectives if they can use and even create opportunities to change which resources they hold at various times Driven by resource constraints the agents could break their overall missions into an optimal series of phases optimal ly recon gu ring their resources at each phase and optimal ly using their assigned resources in each phase given their knowledge of the stochastic environment In this paper we formally de ne and analyze this constrained sequential optimization problem in both the single agent and multi agent contexts We present family of mixed integer linear programming ILP formulations of this problem that can optimal ly create phases when phases are not pre de ned accounting for costs and limitations in phase creation Because our formulations simultaneously also nd the optimal allocations of resources at each phase and the optimal policies for using the allocated resources at each phase they exploit structure across these coupled problems This allows them to nd solutions sign cant ly faster orders of magnitude faster in larger problems than alternative solution techniques as we demonstrate empirically

What can transmission do for fully renewable Europe Sarah Becker Rolando Rodriguez Gorm Andresen Martin reiner and Stefan Schr mm FI AS Frankfurt Frankfurt University Germany Department of Engineering and Department of Mathematics Aarhus University Denmark September Abstract Our research is centred around the question how to best integrate the variable renew able energy sources VRES wind power and solar photovoltaics into the European electricity grid The future electricity supply will be based to large extend on these uc tua ting resources We have conducted study extrapolating national historical and targeted wind and solar power penetrations in Europe up to VRES high share of VRES means large uc tu at ions in the genera tion causing overproduction and dec its One way to reduce such mismatches is power transmission spatially smoothing out the uc tu at ions This has the potential to reduce the remaining shortages by sharing the surplus production of others We nd that shortages can at maximum be reduced by in the hypothetical case of unlimited transmission capacities across all of Europe more realistic extension of the transmission grid roughly quadrupling todays installation turns out to be uci ent to harvest of this potential be net Finally the import and export of single countries is investigated We conclude that country load size as well as its position in the network are the determining factors for its import export opportunities Motivation The ambitious goal of the European Union to reduce green house gases in particular CO by by entails shift to almost completely CO free electricity generation in the same time horizon large part of this renewable generation will come from the variable renewable energy sources VRES wind and solar PV Due to their intermittent nature their integration into the power system poses considerable challenge To this end various measures have been proposed and to some extend also tested or implemented Energy storage systems demand side management DSM Smart Grid technologies or coupling to the other energy sectors heating cooling and transportation via electrical heating cooling electric vehicles or fuel generation from electricity and vice versa all have the potential to shift load and or generation in time thus reducing the mismatch between the two Another path to follow to reduce the mismatch between load and generation is its spatial distribution over larger areas power transmission Wind power production for example has been shown to de correlate over the range of km for the cases of the US East Coast and Sweden Such spatial smoothing has the potential to yield more even generation output and hence better chance to match it to the load In this proceedings we assess the potential of transmission from purely technical point of view We investigate what transmission is able to do as well as what it cannot do Economics are not taken into account Furthermore we look for ec ent ways of enhancing the transmission grid and develop tentative road map of which links should be reinforced and when and we explore the eec ts of such an enhanced transmission grid on the trade opportunities of single countries Parts of these results have been published in Here we present additional discussion of the factors that in en ce country import and export opportunities and show the time development of the distributions of the mismatch between load and renewable generation The latter reveal that transmission is particularly well suited to reduce the occur en ce of small mismatch events but the mitigation of large mismatches remains major challenge even when an upgraded transmission grid is available Corresponding author mail becker as uni frankfurt de

Diu sion Models for Double ended Queues with Renewal Arrival Processes in Liu Qi Gong and Vidya har Kul karn Department of Mathematical Sciences Clemson University Clemson SC Department of Statistics and Operations Research University of North Carolina Chapel Hill NC October Abstract We study double ended queue where buyers and sellers arrive to conduct trades When there is pair of buyer and seller in the system they immediately transact trade and leave Thus there cannot be non zero number of buyers and sellers simultaneously in the system We assume that sellers and buyers arrive at the system according to independent renewal processes and they would leave the system after independent exponential patience times We establish id and diu sion approximations for the queue length process under suitable asymptotic regime The id limit is the solution of an ordinary dieren ti al equation and the diu sion limit is time in homogeneous asymmetric Or nste in hlen beck process process heavy tra analysis is also developed and the diu sion limit in the stronger heavy tra regime is time homogeneous asymmetric process The limiting distributions of both diu sion limits are obtained We also show the interchange of the heavy tra and steady state limits Email liu clemson edu Email gong email unc edu Email kul karn email unc edu
