No name manuscript No will be inserted by the editor Mass concentration in non local model of cl on al selection Bus se Gw zd Marcin ak Cz och ra Received Accepted date Abstract Self renewal is constitutive property of stem cells Testing the cancer stem cell hypothesis requires investigation of the impact of self renewal on cancer expansion To better understand this impact we propose mathematical model describing the dynamics of continuum of cell clones structured by the self renewal potential The model is an extension of the nite multi compartment models of interactions between normal and cancer cells in acute leukemias It takes form of system of in te gro dieren ti al equations with nonlinear and non local coupling which describes regulatory feedback loops of cell proliferation and dieren ti ation We show that this coupling leads to mass concentration in points corresponding to the maxima of the self renewal potential and the solutions of the model tend asymptotically to Dirac measures multiplied by positive constants Furthermore using Lyapunov function constructed for the nite dimensional counterpart of the model we prove that the total mass of the solution converges to globally stable equilibrium Additionally we show stability of the model in the space of pos it iveR don measures equipped with the at metric bounded Lipschitz distance Analytical results are illustrated by numerical simulations Keywords in te gro dieren ti al equations mass concentration Lyapunov functions election process cl on al evolution cell dieren ti ation model bounded Lipschitz distance Gw zd Institute of Applied Mathematics and Mechanics University of Warsaw ul Ban acha Warsaw Poland Marcin ak Cz och ra Institute of Applied Mathematics Interdisciplinary Center for Sci en tic Computing WR and BIO QUANT University of Heidelberg Im Neue he mer Fe ld Heidelberg Germany Bus se Institute of Applied Mathematics BIO QUANT University of Heidelberg Im Neue he mer Fe ld

Adaptive Power Management for Wireless Base Station in Smart Grid Environment Du it Ni ya to Xiao Lu and Ping Wang School of Computer Engineering Nanyang Technological University Singapore Abstract The growing concerns of global environmental change raises revolution on the way of utilizing energy In wireless industry green wireless communications has recently gained increasing attention and is expected to play major role in reduction of electrical power consumption In particular actions to promote energy saving of wireless communications with regard to environmental protection are becoming imperative To this purpose we study green communication system model where wireless base station is provisioned with combination of renewable power source and electrical grid to minimize power consumption as well as meeting the users demand More spec ic ally we focus on an adaptive power management for wireless base station to minimize power consumption under various uncertainties including renewable power generation power price and wireless tr afc load We believe that demand side power management solution based on the studied communication architecture is major step towards green wireless communications

Non homogeneous time convolutions renewal processes and age dependent mean number of motorcar accidents FU LVIO GISMO NDI JACQUES JANSSEN and RAIMONDO MAN CA University Guglielmo Marconi Via Pli nio Roma Italy Honorary professor at the Solvay Business School UL Rue de la Colline Tubize Belgium University of Rome La pienza via del Castro Lauren zia no Roma Italy raimondo man ca uni roma it tel fax Work partially supported by IUR PR IN and La pienza grants Abstract Non homogeneous renewal processes are not yet well established One of the tools necessary for studying these processes is the non homogeneous time convolution Renewal theory has great relevance in general in economics and in particular in actuarial science however most actuarial problems are connected with the age of the insured person The introduction of non homogeneity in the renewal processes brings actuarial applications closer to the real world This paper will define the non homogeneous time convolutions and try to give order to the non homogeneous renewal processes The numerical aspects of these processes are dealt with and finally real data application to an aspect of motorcar insurance is proposed Keywords Non homogeneous time Convolution Renewal processes Numerical solution Motorcar Insurance MSC primary secondary

Department of Physics Aarhus University Aarhus Denmark Department of Engineering Aarhus University Aarhus Denmark Department of Mathematics Aarhus University Aarhus Denmark Abstract Wind and solar PV generation data for the entire contiguous US are calculated on the basis of years of weather data with temporal resolution of one hour and spatial resolution of km assuming site suitability based as well as stochastic wind and solar PV capacity distributions throughout the country These data are used to investigate fully renewable electricity system resting primarily upon wind and solar PV power We nd that the seasonal optimal mix of wind and solar PV comes at around solar PV share owing to the US summer load peak By picking this mix long term storage requirements can be more than halved patterns COE vary by up to due to regional conditions and COE optimal mixes turn out to largely follow resource quality transmission network enhancement among FER regions is constructed to transfer generation solar PV power generation power transmission

Ec ent Modeling and Forecasting of Electricity Spot Prices Florian Zi el Rick Steiner Sven Hus mann October Abstract The increasing importance of renewable energy especially solar and wind power has led to new forces in the formation of electricity prices Hence this paper introduces an econometric model for the hourly time series of electricity prices of the European Power Exchange EP EX which incorporates spec ic features like renewable energy The model consists of several sophisticated and established approaches and can be regarded as periodic VAR ARCH with wind power solar power and load as in en ces on the time series It is able to map the distinct and well known features of electricity prices in Germany An ec ent iterative ly re weighted lasso approach is used for the estimation Moreover it is shown that several existing models are outperformed by the procedure developed in this paper

ZEROS OF RANDOM TROPICAL POLYNOMIALS RANDOM POLYTOPES AND STICK BREAKING FRANCOIS BAC CELLI AND NGO MAI TR AN Abstract For let be independent and identically distributed random variables with distribution with support The number of zeros of the random tropical polynomials min ix is also the number of faces of the lower convex hull of the random points in We show that this number satis es central limit theorem when has polynomial decay near Spec ic ally if near behaves like gamma distribution for some then has the same asymptotic as the number of renewals on the interval log of renewal process with inter arrival distribution log Beta Our proof draws on connections between random partitions renewal theory and random polytopes In particular we obtain generalizations and simple proofs of the central limit theorem for the number of vertices of the convex hull of uniform random points in square Our work leads to many open problems in stochastic tropical geometry the study of functional and intersections of random tropical varieties

Duration Differentiated Services in Electricity shu tosh Nayyar Matias Ne grete Pin ceti Ka mesh war Pool la and rav in Vara iy Abstract The integration of renewable sources poses challenges at the operational and economic levels of the power grid In terms of keeping the balance between supply and demand the usual scheme of supply following load may not be appropriate for large penetration levels of uncertain and intermittent renewable supply In this paper we focus on an alternative scheme in which the load follows the supply exploiting the ex bil it associated with the demand side We consider model of ex ble loads that are to be serviced by zero marginal cost renewable power together with conventional generation if necessary Each load demands kW for specie number of time slots within an operational period The ex bil it of load resides in the fact that the service may be delivered over any slots within the operational period Loads therefore require ex ble energy services that are differentiated by the demanded duration We focus on two problems associated with durations differentiated loads The rst problem deals with the operational decisions that supplier has to make to serve given set of duration differentiated loads The second problem focuses on market implementation for duration differentiated services We give necessary and ufc ent conditions under which the available power can service the loads and we describe an algorithm that constructs an appropriate allocation In the event the available supply is inadequate we characterize the minimum amount of power that must be purchased to service the loads Next we consider forward market where consumers can purchase duration differentiated energy services We rst characterize social welfare maximizing allocations in this forward market and then show the existence of an efc ent competitive equilibrium We also investigate the competitive equilibrium in sequence of real time spot markets with ex ble loads We show by an example that the sequence of real time markets may not be efc ent The rst author is with Ming Hsieh Department of Electrical Engineering at University of Southern California The second third and fourth authors are with the Department of Electrical Engineering and Computer Sciences University of California Berkeley The second author is also with the Department of Electrical Engineering of Pontic Universidad Cato lica de Chile This work was supported in part by EPR and CERT under sub award SER NSF under Grants EEC CP and CNS the Republic of Singapore National Research Estimation of the Hawkes Process With Renewal Immigration Using the EM Algorithm Spencer Wheatley Vladimir Fi limo nov and Didier ornette Dept of Management Technology and Economics ETH Zurich Zurich Switzerland Swiss Finance Institute University of Geneva July Abstract We introduce the Hawkes process with renewal immigration and make its stat is ical estimation possible with two Expectation Maximization EM algorithms The standard Hawkes process introduces immigrant points via Poisson process and each immigrant has subsequent cluster of associated spring of multiple genera ions We generalize the immigration to come from Renewal process introducing dependence between neighbouring clusters and allowing for over under dispersion in cluster locations This complicates evaluation of the likelihood since one needs to know which subset of the observed points are immigrants Two EM algorithms enable estimation here The rst is an extension of an existing algorithm that treats the entire branching structure which points are immigrants and which point is the parent of each spring as missing data The second considers only if point is an immigrant or not as missing data and can be implemented with linear time complexity Both algorithms are found to be consistent in simulation studies Fur the we show that mis specifying the immigration process introduces sign cant bias into model estimation especially the branching ratio which quan ties the strength of self excitation Thus this extended model provides valuable alternative model in practice Keywords Expectation maximization algorithm Branching process models Re new al Cluster process models Point process models non parametric estimation wheatley et hz ch limo nov et hz ch ds ornette et hz ch

Grid Integration Costs of Fluctuating Renewable Energy Sources Jonas Muller Marcus Hil mann Andreas Ul big and Goran Andersson Power Systems Laboratory ETH Zurich Zurich Switzerland mu elle jo et hz ch hil mann ul big andersson eh ee et hz ch Abstract The grid integration of intermittent renewable energy sources RES causes costs for grid operators due to forecast uncertainty and the resulting production schedule mismatches These so called role service costs are marginal cost components and can be understood as an insurance fee against RES production schedule uncertainty that the system operator incurs due to the obligation to always provides ufc ent control reserve capacity for power imbalance mitigation This paper studies the situation for the German power system and the existing German RES support schemes The role service costs incurred by German transmission system operators TSO are quan tied and means for cost reduction are discussed In general role service costs are dependent on the RES prediction error and the spec ic workings of the power markets via which the prediction error is balanced This paper shows both how the prediction error can be reduced in daily operation as well show role service costs can be reduced via optimization against power markets and or active curtailment of RES generation Index Terms Cost Structure of Renewable Energy Sources RES Power Markets Forecast Error RES Grid Integration

Correction Term for the Co variance of Renewal Reward Processes with Multivariate Rewards Brendan Patch Yon Na zara thy and Thomas Tai mre July Abstract We consider renewal reward process with multivariate rewards Such process is constructed from an sequence of time periods to each of which there is associated multivariate reward vector The rewards in each time period may depend on each other and on the period length but not on the other time periods Rewards are accumulated to form vector valued process that exhibits jumps in all coordinates simultaneously only at renewal epochs We derive an asymptotically exact expression for the co variance function over time of the rewards which is used to rene central limit theorem for the vector of rewards As illustrated by numerical example this rene ment can yield improved accuracy especially for moderate time horizons Keywords renewal process renewal reward process multivariate rewards co variance time curve central limit theorem

Duration differentiated Energy Services with Continuum of Loads shu tosh Nayyar Matias Ne grete Pin ceti Ka mesh war Pool la and rav in Vara iy Abstract As the proportion of total power supplied by renewable sources increases it gets more costly to use reserve generation to compensate for the variability of renewables like solar and wind Hence attention has been drawn to exploiting ex bil it yin demand as substitute for reserve generation Flexibility has different attributes In this paper we consider loads requiring constant power for specie duration within say one day whose ex bil it resides in the fact that power maybe delivered at anytime so long as the total duration of service equals the loads specie duration We give conditions under which variable power supply is adequate to meet these ex ble loads and describe how to allocate the power to the loads We also characterize the additional power needed when the supply is inadequate We study the problem of allocating the available power to loads to maximize welfare and show that the welfare optimum can be sustained as competitive equilibrium in forward market in which electricity is sold as service contracts differentiated by the duration of service and power level We compare this forward market with spot market in their ability to capture the ex ib lit inherent in duration differentiated loads

SEPTEMBER Adaptive Robust Optimization with Dynamic Uncertainty Sets for Multi Period Economic Dispatch under Sign cant Wind Alvaro Lorca and Xu Andy Sun Abstract The exceptional be nets of wind power as an environmentally responsible renewable energy resource have led to an increasing penetration of wind energy into days power systems This trend has started to reshape the paradigms of power system operations as dealing with uncertainty caused by the highly intermittent and uncertain wind power becomes sign can tissue Motivated by this we present new framework using adaptive robust optimization for the economic dispatch of power systems with high level of wind penetration In particular we propose an adaptive robust optimization model for multi period economic dispatch and introduce the concept of dynamic uncertainty sets and methods to construct such sets to model temporal and spatial correlations of uncertainty We also develop simulation platform which combines the proposed robust economic dispatch model with statistical prediction tools in rolling horizon framework We have conducted extensive computational experiments on this platform using real wind data The results are promising and demonstrate the be nets of our approach in terms of cost and reliability over existing robust optimization models as well as recent look ahead dispatch models Index Terms Economic dispatch renewable energy adaptive robust optimization uncertainty sets

Lunar Resources Review Accepted for publication in Progress in Physical Geography Note that to comply with the publishers policy this pre print is the originally submitted version The accepted peer reviewed version which differs from this only in minor respects and includes some additional references is available from the author on request Ian Crawford Department of Earth and Planetary Sciences Birk beck College University of London Male Street London WC HX Email crawford bb ac uk Abstract There is growing interest in the possibility that the resource base of the Solar System might in future be used to supplement the economic resources of our own planet As the Earths closest celestial neighbour the Moon is sure to feature prominently in these developments In this paper review what is currently known about economically exploit able resources on the Moon while also stressing the need for continued lunar exploration find that although it is difficult to identify any single lunar resource that will be sufficiently valuable to drive lunar resource extraction industry on its own notwithstanding claims sometimes made for the He isotope which find to be exaggerated the Moon nevertheless does possess abundant raw materials that are of potential economic interest These are relevant to hierarchy of future applications beginning with the use of lunar materials to facilitate human activities on the Moon itself and progressing to the use of lunar resources to underpin future industrial capability within the Earth Moon system In this way gradually increasing access to lunar resources may help bootstrap space based economy from which the world economy and possibly also the worlds environment will ultimately benefit Keywords Moon lunar resources space economy space exploration

New Family of Fractional Renewal Processes Jung Hun Han Abstract Fractional renewal processes as generalization of Poisson process are already in the literature In this paper by introducing new concept of generalized density function the authors construct new fractional renewal processes in the fractional space and show that it is another interesting and useful generalization of Poisson process Keywords Levy density function fractional renewal process fractional acul us Mit tag Leer function AMS Subject Classic at ions

Semi Automatic Construction of Domain Ontology for Wind Energy Using Wikipedia Articles Dile Ku cuk Yusuf rsl an Power Electronics Department TUB IT AK Energy Institute Ankara Turkey Department of Computer Engineering Middle East Technical University Ankara Turkey Abstract Domain on to logie are important information sources for knowledge based systems Yet building domain on to logie from scratch is known to be very labor intensive process In this study we present our semi automatic approach to building an ontology for the domain of wind energy which is an important type of renewable energy with growing share in electricity generation all over the world Related Wikipedia articles are rst processed in an automated manner to determine the basic concepts of the domain together with their properties and next the concepts properties and relationships are organized to arrive at the ultimate ontology We also provide pointers to other engineering on to logie which could be utilized together with the proposed wind energy ontology in addition to its prospective application areas The current study is sign cant as to the best of our knowledge it proposes the rst considerably wide coverage ontology for the wind energy domain and the ontology is built through semi automatic process which makes use of the related Web resources there by reducing the overall cost of the ontology building process Keywords wind energy wind power domain ontology text mining Web mining Corresponding author Tel fax Email addresses dile ku cuk tub it ak gov tr Dile Ku cuk yusuf rsl an eng met edu tr Yusuf rsl an Pre print submitted to Else vier November

Fluid Me ch in press Weak strong clustering transition in renewing compressible ow in kya Dhana gare Stefano Mu sacchi and Dario Vince nz Universit Nice Sophia Anti polis CNRS Labor to ire Dieu donne MR Nice France We investigate the statistical properties of Lagrangian tracers transported by time correlated compressible renewing ow We show that the preferential sampling of the phase space performed by tracers yields sign cant dieren ces between the Lagrangian statistics and its Eulerian counterpart In particular the eec ti ve compress bil it experienced by tracers has an on trivial dependence on the time correlation of the ow We examine the consequence of this phenomenon on the clustering of tracers focusing on the transition from the weak to the strong clustering regime Wend that the critical compress bil it at which the transition occurs is minimum when the time correlation of the ow is of the order of the typical eddy turnover time Further we demonstrate that the clustering properties in time correlated compressible ow are non universal and are strongly in en ced by the patio temporal structure of the velocity el

Dimensional Analysis Centenary Update Dan Jons son March Abstract It is time to renew old ways of thinking about dimensional analysis Spec ic ally more than nr in variants and more than one functional relation between in variants need to be considered simultaneously Thus generalized dimensional analysis can yield more information than prev ou sly recognized Buckingham theorem Bu and its predecessors Va Ria were for mu late years or more ago The basic principles of dimensional analysis have remained unchanged since then Yet careful investigation reveals that di mens ional analysis rests on presuppositions which unnecessarily limit the scope and power of the analysis This is implied by the examination of basic notions related to dimensional analysis in Jo this article will explain more exp li it ly how dimensional analysis should be extended to transcend its self imposed limitations Dimensional analysis should be liberated from some traditional constraints Dimensional analysis as depicted in well known classical expositions Bri Se Ba can be summarized as follows We want to express dependent quantity as function of independent quantities where thus we assume that or equivalently and sometimes more conveniently We also assume that the quantities can all be expressed in terms of one or more fundamental units of measurement corresponding tom dimensions such as Length Time and Mass where Dimensional analysis makes it possible to nd so called groups such that can be written as for some such that The groups are invariant products of powers of meaning that the numerical values of these products do not depend

Cost Aware Green Cellular Networks with Energy and Communication Cooperation Jie Xu Ling jie Duan and Rui Zhang Abstract Energy cost of cellular networks is ever increasing to match the surge of wireless data tr afc and the saving of this cost is important to reduce the operational expenditure OP EX of wireless operators in future The recent advancements of renewable energy integration and two way energy ow in smart grid provide potential new solutions to save the cost However they also impose challenges especially on how to use the stochastic ally and spatially distributed renewable energy harvested at cellular base stations BS to reliably supply time and space varying wireless tr afc over cellular networks To overcome these challenges in this article we present three approaches namely energy cooperation communication cooperation and joint energy and communication cooperation in which different BS bidirectional ly trade or share energy via the aggregator in smart grid and or share wireless resources and shift loads with each other to reduce the total energy cost

th International Scientific Conference May Tatran sk Matli are Energy Ecology Economy High Tatras Slovak Republic COMPUTER NETWORKS NEW GENERATION IN THE USE OF RES Kul tan kono mick un iver zita Brat slave kul tan gmail com Kul tan Slovensk tech nick un iver zita Brat slave mate kul ta gmail com Abstract The paper is aimed at analyzing the potential of new information networks to solve the problems of energy management network with the use of renewable energy sources One of the basic problems of renewable energy sources is their temporal and spatial variability It is mainly about resources based on direct solar radiation and wind speed New computer systems that use only classical connection based solid structure of computer network connections but also on the basis of short range connections allow accurate prediction of the active intensity changes observed energy Using the system thus created can control precisely the basic energy equipment generator and operable appliances gradient to reduce the power needed resources or from work This approach is one of the directions of further development of smart appliances and smart elements in the energy sector Keywords elements in smart energy smart new generation information networks adaptive control power

Limit theorems for random walks on Fuchsia buildings and Kac Moody groups Gil ch Muller Parkinson September Abstract In this paper we prove rate of escape theorem and central limit theorem for isotropic random walks on Fuchsia buildings giving formulae for the speed and asymptotic var ance In particular these results apply to random walks induced by bi invariant measures on Fuchsia Kac Moody groups however they also apply to the case where the building is not associated to any reasonable group structure Our primary strategy is to construct renewal structure of the random walk For this purpose we de ne cones and cone types for buildings and prove that the corresponding automata in the building and the underlying Coxeter group are strongly connected The limit theorems are then proven by adapting the techniques in The moments of the renewal times are controlled via the retraction of the walks on to an apartment of the building Keywords random walk limit theorems Fuchsia building Kac Moody group Cannon automaton Mathematics Subject Classification

Multidimensional Random Polymers Renewal Approach Dmitry of fe Abstract In these lecture notes which are based on the mini course given at Prague School on Mathematical Statistical Physics we discuss ballistic phase of quenched and annealed stretched polymers in random environment on Zd with an emphasis on the natural re normalized renewal structures which appear in such mod els In the ballistic regime an irreducible decomposition of typical polymers leads to an effective random walk reinterpretation of the latter In the annealed case the Or nste in er nike theory based on this approach paves the way to an essentially complete control on the level of local limit results and in variance principles In the quenched case the renewal structure maps the model of stretched polymers into an effective model of directed polymers As result one is able to use techniques and ideas developed in the context of directed polymers in order to address issues like strong disorder in low dimensions and weak disorder in higher dimensions Among the topics addressed Thermodynamics of quenched and annealed models multi dimensional renewal theory under Cramer condition re normalization and ef fec ti ve random walk structure of annealed polymers very weak disorder in dimensions and strong disorder in dimensions

Estimation of Joint Distribution of Demand and Available Renewables for Generation Adequacy Assessment Zachary and Dent December Abstract In recent years there has been resurgence of interest in generation adequacy risk assessment due to the need to include variable generation renewables within such calculations This paper will describe new statistical approaches to estimating the joint distribution of demand and available VG capacity this is required for the LOL calculations used in many statutory adequacy studies for example those of GB and PJM The most popular estimation technique in the VG integration literature is hind cast in which the historic joint distribution of demand and available VG is used as predictive distribution Through the use of bootstrap statistical analysis this paper will show that due to extreme sparsity of data on times of high demand and low VG hind cast results can sue from sampling uncertainty to the extent that they have little practical meaning An alternative estimation approach in which marginal distribution of available VG is re scaled according to demand level is thus proposed This reduces sampling uncertainty at the expense of the additional model structure assumption and further provides means of assessing the sensitivity of model out puts to the VG demand relationship by varying the function of demand by which the marginal VG distribution is re scaled Keywords power system planning power system reliability risk analysis wind power

ON MULTIVARIATE STRONG RENEWAL THEOREM Zhi yi Chi Department of Statistics University of Connecticut torr CT USA mail zhi yi chi uconn edu January Abstract This paper takes the so called probabilistic approach to the Strong Renewal Theorem RT for multivariate distributions in the domain of attraction of stable law version of the RT is obtained that allows any kind of lattice non lattice composition of distribution general bound is derived to control the so called small contribution which arises from random walk paths that have relatively small number of steps but make large cumulative moves The asymptotic neglig bil it of the small contribution is essential to the RT Applications of the RT are given including some that provide unie treatment to known results but with substantially weaker assumptions Keywords and phrases Renewal regular variation inn it ely divisible large deviations Mathematics Subject Classic ation

Sharing Non Anonymous Costs of Multiple Resources Optimal ly Max Kli mm Daniel Schm and July Abstract In cost sharing games the existence and ec ien cy of pure Nash qui libri fundamentally depends on the method that is used to share the resources costs We consider general class of resource allocation pro lem in which set of resources is used by heterogeneous set of sel sh users The cost of resource is non decreasing function of the set of its users Under the assumption that the costs of the resources are shared by uniform cost sharing protocols protocols that use only lo cal information of the resources cost structure and its users to determine the cost shares we exactly quantify the in ec ien cy of the resulting pure Nash qui libri Spec ic ally we show tight bounds on prices of stab il it and anarchy for games with only sub modular and only super modular cost functions respectively and an asymptotically tight bound for games with arbitrary set functions While all our upper bounds are attained for the well known Shapley cost sharing protocol our lower bounds hold for arbitrary uniform cost sharing protocols and are even valid for games with anonymous costs games in which the cost of each resource only depends on the cardinality of the set of its users

Renewable build up pathways for the US Generation costs are not system costs Sarah Becker Bethany re wb Gorm Andresen Mark Jacobson Stefan Schr amma Martin reiner Frankfurt Institute for Advanced Studies Goethe Universit Frankfurt am Main Germany Department of Civil and Environmental Engineering Stanford University Stanford CA USA Department of Engineering Aarhus University Aarhus Denmark Department of Mathematics Aarhus University Aarhus Denmark Abstract The transition to future electricity system based primarily on wind and solar PV is examined for all regions in the contiguous US We present optimized pathways for the build up of wind and solar power for least backup energy needs as well as for least cost obtained with as implied lightweight model based on long term high resolution weather determined generation data In the absence of storage the pathway which achieves the best match of generation and load thus resulting in the least backup energy requirements generally favors combination of both technologies with wind solar PV energy mix of about in fully renewable scenario The least cost development is seen to start with of the technology with the lowest average generation costs rst but with increasing renewable installations economically unfavorable excess generation pushes it toward the minimal backup pathway Surplus generation and the entailed costs can be reduced sign cant ly by combining wind and solar power and or absorbing excess generation for example with storage or transmission or by coupling the electricity system to other energy sectors Keywords energy system design large scale integration of renewable power generation renewable power generation optimal mix of wind and solar PV level zed cost of electricity

TECHNICAL REPORT IN UNIVERSITY OF HELSINKI FINLAND Technical Report Renewable Energy Aware Information Centric Networking Julien Mine raud Liang Wang as it har an Bala subramania Senior Member IEEE and Jussi Kang as harju Member IEEE Abstract The ICT industry today is placed as one of the major consumers of energy where recent reports have also shown that the industry is major contributor to global carbon emissions While renewable energy aware datacenter have been proposed these solutions have certain limitations The primary limitation is due to the design of datacenter which focus on large size facilities located in selected locations This paper addresses this problem by utilizing in network caching with each router having storage and being powered by renewable energy sources wind and solar Besides placing contents closer to end users utilizing in network caching could potentially increase probability of capturing renewable energy in diverse geographical locations Our proposed solution is dual layered on the rst layer distributed gradient based routing protocol is used to discover the paths along routers that are powered by the highest renewable energy and on the second layer caching mechanism will pull the contents from the data centre and place them on routers of the paths that are discovered by our routing protocol Through our experiments on test bed utilizing real meteorological data our proposed solution has demonstrated increased quantity of renewable energy consumption while reducing the workload on the datacenter Index Terms renewable energy energy aware routing in network caching cid

An BDM MM Algorithm Based Framework for Allocation of Resources in Cloud Mansa Alam and Kashi sh Ara Sh akil Abstract Cloud computing is technological advancement in the arena of computing and has taken the utility vision of computing step further by providing computing resources such as network storage compute capacity and servers as service via an internet connection These services are provided to the users in pay per use manner subjected to the amount of usage of these resources by the cloud users Since the usage of these resources is done in an elastic manner thus an on demand provisioning of these resources is the driving force behind the entire cloud computing infrastructure therefore the maintenance of these resources is decisive task that must be taken into account Eventually infrastructure level performance monitoring and enhancement is also important This paper proposes framework for allocation of resources in cloud based environment there by leading to an infrastructure level enhancement of performance in cloud environment The framework is divided into four stages Stage Cloud service provider monitors the infrastructure level pattern of usage of resources and behavior of the cloud users Stage Report the monitoring activities about the usage to cloud service providers Stage Apply proposed Network Bandwidth Dependent MMM algorithm Stage Allocate resources or provide services to cloud users there by leading to infrastructure level performance enhancement and efficient management of resources Analysis of resource usage pattern is considered as an important factor for proper allocation of resources by the service providers in this paper Google cluster trace has been used for accessing the resource usage pattern in cloud Experiments have been conducted on clouds im simulation framework and the results reveal that BDM MM algorithm improvises allocation of resources in virtual zed cloud Index Terms Cloud computing decision matrix based max min algorithm infrastructure performance Network bandwidth dependent MMM algorithm priority scheduling resource provisioning

Wind Resource Assessment in Europe Using Emer gy Su bodh Pau del Massimo Sant are lli Viktoria Martin Bruno La carrier Olivier Le Corre Department of Energy Systems and Environment Ecole des Mines de Nantes GE PEA CNRS France Department of Electrical Engineering Eindhoven University of Technology The Netherlands Department of Energy Polite nico di Torino Italy Department of Energy Technology TH Royal Institute of Technology Sweden Corresponding Author le corre mines nantes fr Abstract In context of increasing use of renewable sources it is of importance to correctly evaluate the actual sustainability of their implementation Emer gy analysis is one of the possible methods useful for such an as ses ment This work aims to demonstrate how the emer gy approach can be used to assess the sustainability of wind energy resource in Europe The Emer gy Index of Sustainability IS and the Emer gy Yield Ratio YR are used to analyze stations of European regions for three types of wind turbines To do so the simplified Chou wind turbine model is used for different set of parameters as nominal power and size of the wind tur bin es and cut in and cut out wind speeds Based on the calculation of the emer gy indices mapping is pro posed to identify the most appropriate locations for an implementation of wind turbines in European regions The influence of the wind turbine type on the sustainability is also analyzed in link with the local wind re source Thus it is concluded that the emer gy sustainability indices are sensitive to the wind turbine design parameters size cut in and cut out wind speed Keywords Wind resource assessment Emer gy Analysis Sustainability

Robustness of Spatial Micro networks Thomas Mc Andrew Christopher Danforth and James Ba grow Department of Mathematics and Statistics University of Vermont Burlington VT United States Vermont Complex Systems Center University of Vermont Burlington VT United States Dated July Abstract Power lines roadways pipelines and other physical infrastructure are critical to modern society These structures may be viewed as spatial networks where geographic distances play role in the functionality and construction cost of links Traditionally studies of network robustness have primarily considered the connected ness of large random networks Yet for spatial infrastructure physical distances must also play role in network robustness Understanding the robustness of small spatial networks is particularly important with the increasing interest in micro grids small area distributed power grids that are well suited to using renewable energy resources We study the random failures of links in small networks where functionality depends on both spatial distance and topological connected ness By introducing percolation model where the failure of each link is proportional to its spatial length we nd that when failures depend on spatial distances networks are more fragile than expected Accounting for spatial eec ts in both construction and robustness is important for designing ec ent micro grids and other network infrastructure Thomas Mc Andrew uv edu www uv edu tm can dre

Renewal Approach to the Analysis of the Asynchronous State for Coupled Noisy Oscillators Far ad Far khoo and Carl van rees wijk Neuro informatics Theoretical Neuroscience Freie Universitat Berlin and BCC Berlin Germany Centre de Neuro physique Ph sio logie et Path logie Paris Descartes University and CNRS MR Paris France Dated November We develop framework in which the activity of nonlinear pulse coupled oscillators is posed within the renewal theory In this approach the evolution of inter event density allows for self consistent calculation that determines the asynchronous state and its stability This framework can readily be extended to the analysis of systems with more state variables To exhibit this we study nonlinear pulse coupled system where couplings are dynamic and activity Optimal Two Tier Forecasting Power Generation Model in Smart Grids Kia noo sh Boro oj eni She kou feh Mok ht ari mini and yen gar School of Computing and Information Sciences Florida International University Miami Florida USA Department of Electrical and Computer Engineering Carnegie Mellon University Pittsburgh PA USA Abstract There has been an increasing trend in the electric power system from centralized generation driven grid to more reliable environmental friendly and customer driven grid One of the most important issues which the designers of smart grids need to deal with is to forecast the uc tu at ions of power demand and generation in order to make the power system facilities more ex ble to the variable nature of renew able power resources and demand side This paper proposes novel two tier scheme for forecasting the power demand and generation in general residential electrical gird which uses the distributed renew able resources as the primary energy resource The proposed forecasting scheme has two tiers long term demand generation forecaster which is based on Maximum Likelihood Estimator LE and real time demand generation forecaster which is based on Auto Regressive Integrated Moving Average ARIMA model The paper also shows that how bulk generation improves the adequacy of proposed residential system by canceling out the forecasters estimation errors which are in the form of Gaussian White noises Keywords Adequacy Analysis ARIMA Model Forecasting Model Maximum Likelihood Es tima tion Smart Grids

MICROSCOPIC SPIKING NEURON AL NETWORK FOR THE AGE STRUCTURED MODEL CRISTOBAL QUIN IN AO Work in progress Preliminary version of October Abstract We introduce microscopic spiking network consistent with the age structured renewal equation proposed by Pak daman Per thame and Salor It is jump process interacting through global activity variable with random delays We show the well posed ness of the particle system and the mean el equation Moreover we show the propagation of chaos property and we quantify the rate of convergence under the assumption of exponential moments on the initial data Contents

Green power grids how energy from renewable sources affects networks and markets Mario Mu red du Guido Cal dare lli Alessandro Chess Antonio Scala Alfonso Damiano Di parti men to di Fi sica Universit di Cagliari Italy IMT Institute for Advanced Studies Lucca Italy Department of Physics and Earth Sciences Jacobs University Bremen Germany Is it to dei Si stem Comp less IS Roma Italy London Institute for Mathematical Sciences London UK Link lab Cagliari Italy Di parti men to di Inge gner El ett rica ed let tronic Universit di Cagliari Italy alf io die nica it Abstract The increasing attention to environmental issues is forcing the implementation of novel energy models based on renewable sources This is fundamentally changing the configuration of energy management and is introducing new problems that are only partly understood In particular renewable energies introduce fluctuations which cause an increased request for conventional energy sources to balance energy requests at short notice In order to develop an effective usage of low carbon sources such fluctuations must be understood and tamed In this paper we present microscopic model for the description and for the forecast of short time fluctuations related to renewable sources in order to estimate their effects on the electricity market To account for the inter dependencies in the energy market and the physical power dispatch network we use statistical mechanics approach to sample stochastic perturbations in the power system and an agent based approach for the prediction of the market players behavior Our model is data driven it builds on one day ahead real market transactions in order to train agents behaviour and allows us to deduce the market share of different energy sources We benchmarked our approach on the Italian market finding good accordance with real data

Macroscopic description of complex adaptive networks co evolving with dynamic node states Marc Wie der mann Jonathan Dong es Job st He it zig Wolfgang Luc ht and Jurgen Kurth Potsdam Institute for Climate Impact Research Box Potsdam Germany EU Department of Physics Humboldt University Newton str Berlin Germany EU Stockholm Resilience Centre Stockholm University Kraft rike Stockholm Sweden EU Department of Geography Humboldt University Ru do wer Chau see Berlin Germany EU Institute for Complex Systems and Mathematical Biology University of Aberdeen Aberdeen AB FX UK EU Department of Control Theory Nizhny Novgorod State University Gagarin Avenue Nizhny Novgorod Russia Dated October In many real world complex systems the time evolution of the networks structure and the dy nami state of its nodes are closely entangled Here we study opinion formation and imitation on an adaptive complex network which is dependent on the individual dynamic state of each node and vice versa to model the co evolution of renewable resources with the dynamics of harvesting agents on social network The adaptive voter model is coupled to set of identical logistic growth models and we mainly nd that in such systems the rate of interactions between nodes as well as the adaptive rewiring probability are crucial parameters for controlling the sustainability of the systems equilibrium state We derive macroscopic description of the system which provides general framework to model and quantify the in en ce of single node dynamics on the macroscopic state of the network The thus obtained framework is applicable to many lds of study such as epidemic spreading opinion formation or socio ecological modeling PAC numbers Fb Hc Ge

DOI TV Back haul Aware User Association and Resource Allocation for Energy Constrained He Nets Qi on Han Bo Yang Member IEEE Guo wang Miao Member IEEE Cai lian Chen Member IEEE Xiao cheng Wang and in ping Guan Senior Member IEEE Abstract Growing attentions have been paid to renewable energy or hybrid energy powered heterogeneous networks He Nets In this paper focusing on back haul aware joint user association and resource allocation for this type of He Nets we formulate an online optimization problem to maximize the network utility ree ting proportional fairness Since user association and resource allocation are tightly coupled not only on resource consumption of the base stations BS but also in the constraints of their available energy and back haul the closed form solution is quite if cult to obtain Thus we solve the problem distributive ly via employing some decomposition methods Spec ic ally at rst by adopting primal decomposition method we decompose the original problem into lower level resource allocation problem for each BS and higher level user association problem For the optimal resource allocation we prove that BS either assigns equal normalized resources or provides equal long term service rate to its served users Then the user association problem is solved by Lagrange dual decomposition method and completely distributed algorithm is developed Moreover applying results of the sub gradient method we demonstrate the convergence of the proposed distributed algorithm Furthermore in order to efc ent ly and reliably apply the proposed algorithm to the future wireless networks with an extremely dense BS deployment we design virtual user association and resource allocation scheme based on the software de ned networking architecture Lastly numerical results validate the convergence of the proposed algorithm and the sign cant improvement on network utility load balancing and user fairness Index Terms He Nets renewable energy back haul aware user Control of Generalized Energy Storage Networks Junji Qin Yin lam Chow Ji yan Yang Ram Raja gopal Abstract The integration of intermittent and volatile renewable energy resources requires increased ex bil it in the operation of the electric grid Storage broadly speaking provides the ex bil it of shifting energy over time network on the other hand provides the ex bil it of shifting energy over geographical locations The optimal control of general storage networks in uncertain environments is an important open problem The key challenge is that even in small networks the corresponding constrained stochastic control problems with continuous spaces sue from curses of dimensionality and are intractable in general settings For large networks no ec ent algorithm is known to give optimal or near optimal performance This paper provides an ec ent and provably near optimal algorithm to solve this problem in very general setting We study the optimal control of generalized storage networks electric networks connected to distributed generalized storages Here generalized storage is unifying dynamic model for many components of the grid that provide the functionality of shifting energy over time ranging from standard energy storage devices to de ferr able or thermostatic ally controlled loads An online algorithm is devised for the corresponding constrained stochastic control problem based on the theory of Lyapunov optimization We prove that the algorithm is near optimal and construct semi de nite program tom in im ize the sub optimal it bound The resulting bound is constant that depends only on the parameters of the storage network and cost functions and is independent of uncertainty realization Numerical examples are given to demonstrate the eec ti ve ness of the algorithm

Quantitative exponential bounds for the renewal theorem with spread out distributions Bard et Christen and Font bona July Abstract We establish exponential convergence estimates for the renewal theorem in terms of uniform component of the inter arrival distribution of its Laplace transform which is assumed nite on positive interval and of the Laplace transform of some related random variable Although our bounds are not sharp our approach provides tractable constructive estimates for the renewal theorem which are computable theoretically and numerically at least for general class of inter arrival distributions The proof uses coupling and relies on Lyapunov Doe bl in type arguments for some discrete time regenerative structure which we associate with the renewal processes Keywords renewal theorem spread out inter arrivals convergence rate Lyapunov coupling AMS subject classic at ions

ALGORITHMS FOR NON LINEAR AND STOCHASTIC RESOURCE CONSTRAINED SHORTEST PATH AXEL PAR MEN TIER Abstract Resource constrained shortest path problems are usually solved thanks to smart enumeration of all the non dominated paths Recent improvements of these enumeration algorithms rely on the use of bounds on path resources to discard partial solutions The quality of the bounds determines the performance of the algorithm The main contribution of this paper is to introduce standard procedure to generate bounds on paths resources in general setting which covers most resource constrained shortest path problems among which stochastic versions In that purpose we introduce generalization of the resource constrained shortest path pro lem where the resources are taken in mono id The resource of path is the mono id sum of the resources of its arcs The problem consists in ding path whose resource minimizes non decreasing cost function of the path resource among the paths that respect given constraint Enumeration algorithms are generalized to this framework We use lattice theory to provide poly no mi al procedures to nd good quality bounds These procedures solve generalization of the algebraic path problem where arc resources belong to lattice ordered mono id The practical ec ien cy of the approach is proved through an extensive numerical study on some deterministic and stochastic resource constrained shortest path problems

DYNAMIC RESOURCE MANAGEMENT IN CLOUD DATA CENTERS FOR SERVER CONSOLIDATION ALEXANDER GENZ PhD Student Department of Computer Science Engineering Jain University Bangalore India yn genz gmail com Dr ELVA RANI Professor Computer Science Engineering Alliance University Bangalore India elva rani ri ic gmail com Dr SUCH IT HRA NAIR HoD Department of Master of Science in Information Technology Jain University Bangalore India such it hra suri ya gmail com ABSTRACT Cloud resource management has been key factor for the cloud datacenter development Many cloud datacenter have problems in understanding and implementing the techniques to manage allocate and migrate the resources in their premises The consequences of improper resource management may result into under utilized and wastage of resources which may also result into poor service delivery in these datacenter Resources like CPU memory Hard disk and servers need to be well identified and managed In this Paper Dynamic Resource Management Algorithm DRM shall limit itself in the management of CPU and memory as the resources in cloud datacenter The target is to save those resources which may be under utilized at particular period of time It can be achieved through Implementation of suitable algorithms Here Bin packing algorithm can be used whereby the best fit algorithm is deployed to obtain results and compared to select suitable algorithm for efficient use of resources KEYWORDS Best fit Bin packing Cloud computing CPU DRM Server consolidation

An Open Solution to Provide Personalized Feedback for Building Energy Management Andrea Mona chi Fabio Verso lat to Manuel Her old Dominik garter Andrea To nello Wilfried El men reich June Abstract The integration of renewable energy sources increases the complexity in manta in ing the power grid In particular the highly dynamic nature of generation and consumption demands for better utilization of energy re sources which seen the cost of storage infrastructure can only be achieved through demand response Accordingly the availability of energy and po tent al overload situations can be ree ted using price signal The ef fec ti ve ness of this mechanism arises from the ex bil it of device operation which is nevertheless heavily reliant on the exchange of information be tween the grid and its consumers In this paper we investigate the capability of an interactive energy management system to timely in form users on en rgy usage in order to promote an optimal use of local resources In part ic lar we analyze data being collected in several households in Italy and us tria to gain insights into usage behavior and drive the design of more ef fec ti ve systems The outcome is the formulation of energy efc ien cy policies for residential buildings as well as the design of an energy management ys tem consisting of hardware measurement units and management software The Mjolnir framework which we release for open use provides platform where various feedback concepts can be implemented and assessed This Mona chi Her old garter and El men reich are with the Institute of Networked and Embedded Systems Alpen Adri Universitat Klagenfurt Verso lat to and To nello are with WiT iKe eS rl

The lima to logical relationships between wind and solar energy supply in Britain Philip Be tt Hazel Thornton Me tO ce Hadley Centre FitzRoy Road Exeter EX PB United Kingdom Abstract We use reanalysis data to investigate the daily co variability of wind and solar ir radiance in Britain and its implications for renewable energy supply balancing The joint distribution of daily mean windspeeds and ir radiance shows that ir radiance has much stronger seasonal cycle than wind due to the rotational tilt of the Earth Ir radiance is weakly anti correlated with wind speed throughout the year cid cid there is weak tendency for windy days to be cloudier This is particularly true in Atlantic facing regions western Scotland south west England The east coast of Britain has the weakest anti correlation particularly in winter primarily associated with relative increase in the frequency of clear but windy days We also consider the variability in total power output from onshore wind turbines and solar photovoltaic panels In all months daily variability in total power is always reduced by incorporating solar capacity The scenario with the least seasonal variability is approximately solar to wind This work emphasises the importance of considering the full distribution of daily behaviour rather than relying on long term average relationships or correlations In particular the anti correlation between wind and solar power in Britain cannot solely be relied upon to produce well balanced energy supply cid Crown Copyright Me tO ce Keywords wind power generation solar PV power generation climatology energy balancing reanalysis seasonal variability

Power ow tracing in implied highly renewable European electricity network Bo Tra nberg Anders Thomsen Rolando Rodriguez Gorm Andresen Mirko Schafer and Martin reiner Department of Physics Aarhus University Ny Munk gade Aarhus Denmark Department of Mathematics Aarhus University Ny Munk gade Aarhus Denmark Department of Engineering Aarhus University Inge Lehmann Gade Aarhus Denmark Frankfurt Institute for Advanced Studies Ruth Mou fang Str Frankfurt Germany Dated June The increasing transmission capacity needs in future energy system raise the question how associated costs should be allocated to the users of strengthened power grid In contrast to straightforward over implied methods ow tracing based approach provides fair and consistent nodal usage and thus cost assignment of transmission investments This technique follows the power ow through the network and assigns the link capacity usage to the respective sources or sinks using diu sion like process thus taking into account the underlying network structure and injection pattern As showcase we apply power ow tracing to as implied model of the European electricity grid with high share of renewable wind and solar power generation based on long term weather and load data with an hourly temporal resolution PAC numbers Gh Hc Keywords Energy system design Large scale integration of renewable power generation Flow tracing Complex renewable electricity networks

Smoothing eec for spatially distributed renewable resources and its impact on power grid robustness Motoki Nagata Yoshito Hi rata Naoya Fujiwara Gou he Tanaka Hideyuki Suzuki and Kazuyuki ihara Graduate School of Information Science and Technology The University of Tokyo Tokyo Japan Institute of Industrial Science The University of Tokyo Tokyo Japan CREST ST Saitama Japan Center for Spatial Information Science The University of Tokyo Chiba Japan Graduate School of Engineering The University of Tokyo Tokyo Japan Dated September Abstract In this paper we show that spatial correlation of renewable energy outputs greatly in en ces the robustness of power grids First we propose new index for the spatial correlation among renewable energy outputs We nd that the spatial correlation of renewable energy outputs in short time scale is as weak as that caused by independent random variables and that in along time scale is as strong as that under perfect synchronization Then by employing the topology of the power grid in eastern Japan we analyze the robustness of the power grid with spatial correlation of renewable energy outputs The analysis is performed by using realistic dieren ti al algebraic equations model and the result shows that the spatial correlation of the energy resources strongly degrades the robustness of the power grid Our result suggests that the spatial correlation of the renewable energy outputs should be taken into account when estimating the stability of power grids

GENERALIZED POLAND SCHE RAGA DE NATURA TION MODEL AND TWO DIMENSIONAL RENEWAL PROCESSES GIA BATTISTA GIACOMIN AND MAHA KHATIB Abstract The Poland Sche raga model describes the de natura tion transition of two complementary in particular equally long strands of DNA and it has enjoyed remarkable success both for quantitative modeling purposes and at more theoretical level The solvable character of the homogeneous version of the model is one of features to which its success is due In the bio physical literature generalization of the model allowing die rent length and non complement ari ty of the strands has been considered and the solvable character extends to this substantial generalization We present math em at ical analysis of the homogeneous generalized Poland Sche raga model Our approach is based on the fact that such model is homogeneous pinning model based on bi variate renewal process much like the basic Poland Sche raga model is pinning model based on uni variate standard renewal We present complete analysis of the free energy singularities which include the localization delocalization critical point and in general other critical points that have been only partially captured in the physical literature We obtain also precise estimates on the path properties of the model Mathematics Subject Classic ation Keywords DNA De natura tion Polymer Pinning Model Two dimensional Renewal Pro esse Critical Behavior Sharp and Large Deviation Estimates Path Properties

Pragmatic Approach to Sovereignty on Mars Sara Bru hn and Jacob Haq Misr Blue Marble Space Institute of Science th Ave Suite Seattle Washington United States Email jacob bms is org Published in Space Policy doi space pol Abstract Rising interest in Mars colonization from both private and public sectors necessitates renewed discussion about sovereignty in space The non appropriation principle of the Outer Space Treaty currently prohibits any sovereign claims to celestial bodies but it remains unclear how this principle should be applied to the peaceful colonization of Mars Here we develop pragmatic approach to guide the settlement of Mars which is based upon bounded first possession model with mandatory planetary parks Scientists experts and leaders will establish planetary park locations and regulations through worldwide community solicitation in order to protect sites of scientific aesthetic historical cultural environmental spiritual value Colonization parties may occupy limited plots of martian land and may claim exclusive economic rights within this zone while still refraining from any claims to sovereignty All colonists remain under the legal jurisdiction of their host nation with conflicts to be resolved diplomatically or through temporary tribunal system composed of representatives from other Mars colonies We also propose the formation of Mars Secretariat as an administrative body with limited power to facilitate communication among parties Our model for Mars colonization remains consistent with the Outer Space Treaty but we also recommend revisiting or amending the non appropriation and province of mankind principles to resolve the ambiguity of how nations corporations and individuals may utilize the resources of space

November How far can we take the resource theoretic approach to explore physics Resource theories like LOC reference frames and quantum thermodynamics have proven powerful tool to study how agents who are subject to certain constraints can act on physical systems This approach has advanced our understanding of fundamental physical principles such as the second law of thermodynamics and provided operational measures to quantify resources such as entanglement or information content In this work we sign cant ly extend the approach and range of applicability of resource theories Firstly we generalize the notion of resource theories to include any description or knowledge that agents may have of physical state beyond the density operator formalism We show how to relate theories that die in the language used to describe resources like micro and macroscopic thermodynamics Finally we take top down approach to locality in which subsystem structure is derived from global theory rather than assumed The extended framework introduced here enables us to formalize new tasks in the language of resource theories ranging from tomography cryptography thermodynamics and foundational questions both within and beyond quantum theory Operational desiderata Our approach Simple tools to compare and combine descriptions Specifications Fuzzy and partial knowledge separable state General Ar xiv Copy The Sowers Way Quantifying the Narrowing Net Energy Pathways to Global Energy Transition Authors Sg our is gou rid is Ugo Bardi De nes Csa la Affiliations Institute Center for Smart and Sustainable Systems Mas dar Institute of Science and Technology United Arab Emirates Tel Fax University of Florence Department of Earth Sciences Di parti men to di Chi mica Polo Scientific di Sesto Fiorentino Florence Italy Email ugo bardi uni fi it Correspondence to gou rid is mas dar ac Abstract Planning the appropriate renewable energy installation rate should balance two partially contradictory objectives substituting fossil fuels fast enough to stave off the worst consequences of climate change while maintaining sufficient net energy flow to support the world's economy The upfront energy invested in constructing renewable energy infrastructure subtracts from the net energy available for societal energy needs fact typically neglected in energy projections Modeling feasible energy transition pathways to provide different net energy levels we find that they are critically dependent on the fossil fuel emissions cap and phase out profile and on the characteristic energy return on energy invested of the renewable energy technologies The easiest pathway requires installation of renewable energy plants to accelerate from TW year in to peak between and TW year for an early or late fossil fuel phase out respectively in order for emissions to stay within the recommended CO budget Note due to size limits the Supplementary Information cannot be uploaded to Ar xiv Please contact us gou rid is mas dar ac and we can share the file directly

Data Driven Real Time Power Dispatch for Maximizing Variable Renewable Generation Zhi gang Lia Feng Qi ub Jian hui Wang Department of Electrical Engineering Tsinghua University Beijing China Energy Systems Division Argonne National Laboratory Argonne USA Abstract Traditional power dispatch methods have difficulties in accommodating large scale variable renewable generation RG and have resulted in unnecessary RG spillage in the practical industry The recent dispatch able interval based methods have the potential to reduce RG curtailment but the dispatch able intervals are not allocated effectively due to the lack of exploiting historical dispatch records of RG units To bridge this gap this paper proposes novel data driven real time dispatch approach to maximize RG utilization by using do not exceed NE limits This approach defines the maximum generation output ranges that the system can accommodate without compromising reliability The NE limits of RG units and operating base points of conventional units are co optimized by hybrid stochastic and robust optimization and the decision models are formulated as mixed integer linear programs by the sample average approximation technique exploiting historical RG data strategy for selecting historical data samples is also proposed to capture the RG uncertainty more accurately under variant prediction output levels DOI PDS Distributed Control for Charging Multiple Electric Vehicles with Overload Limitation Bo Yang Jing wei Li Qi on Han Tian He Cai lian Chen in ping Guan Abstract Severe pollution induced by traditional fossil fuels arouses great attention on the usage of plug in electric vehicles PE Vs and renewable energy However large scale penetration of PE Vs combined with other kinds of appliances tends to cause excessive or even disastrous burden on the power grid especially during peak hours This paper focuses on the scheduling of PE Vs charging process among different charging stations and each station can be supplied by both renewable energy generators and distribution network The distribution network also powers some uncontrollable loads In order to minimize the on grid energy cost with local renewable energy and non ideal storage while avoiding the overload risk of the distribution network an online algorithm consisting of scheduling the charging of PE Vs and energy management of charging stations is developed based on Lyapunov optimization and Lagrange dual decomposition techniques The algorithm can satisfy the random charging requests from PE Vs with provable performance Simulation results with real data demonstrate that the proposed algorithm can decrease the time average cost of stations while avoiding overload in the distribution network in the presence of random uncontrollable loads Index Terms Electric vehicle charging scheduling renewable energy smart grid Lyapunov opt miz ation Copyright IEEE Personal use of this material is permitted Permission from IEEE marked renewal process model for the size of honey bee colony hua Xia Richard Huggins Martin Barons Louis Guill ota School of Mathematics and Statistics The University of Melbourne Park ville Victoria Australia Department of Statistics The University of Warwick Coventry CV AL United Kingdom Abstract Many areas of agriculture rely on honeybees to provide pollination services and any decline in honey bee numbers can impact on global food security In order to understand the dynamics of honey bee colonies we present discrete time marked renewal process model for the size of colony We demonstrate that under mild conditions this attains stationary distribution that depends on the distribution of the numbers of eggs per batch the probability an egg hatches and the distributions of the times between batches and bee lifetime This allows an analytic examination of the eec of changing these quantities We then extend this model to cyclic annual eec ts where for example the numbers of eggs per batch and the probability an egg hatches may vary over the year Keywords Bee colony size Renewal process Stationary distribution Corresponding author Email address hua xia uni mel edu au hua Xia Research supported by ARC Discovery DP Research supported by EPS RC grant EP Pre print submitted to Else vier November

SOME MATHEMATICAL ASPECTS OF PRICE OPTIMISATION YI ZHOU BAI ENKE LE JD HAS HORV GILDA RAT OVO MIRI AND MA IS SATA MRAZ Abstract Calculation of an optimal tar is principal challenge for pricing actuaries In this contribution we are concerned with the renewal insurance business discussing various ma the mat ical aspects of calculation of an optimal renewal tar Our motivation comes from two important actuarial tasks namely construction of an optimal renewal tar subject to bus ness and technical constraints and determination of an optimal allocation of certain premium loading We consider both continuous and discrete optimisation and then present several al gori th mic sub optimal solutions Additionally we explore some simulation techniques Several illustrative examples show both the complexity and the importance of the optimisation ap roach Key Words market tar optimal tar optimal price price elasticity non life insurance non convex opt mis ation quadratic programming sequential quadratic programming mixed discrete non linear programming constraints renewal business

Mitigating Redundant Data Transfers for Mobile Web Applications via App Spec ic Cache Space Yun Ma Xuan zhe Liu Shuai liang Dong Yun in Liu Tao Xie Abstract Redundant transfer of resources is critical issue for compromising the performance of mobile Web applications apps in terms of data tra load time and even energy consumption Evidence shows that the current cache mechanisms are far from satisfactory With lessons learned from how native apps manage their resources in this paper we propose the Re WAP approach to fundamentally reducing redundant transfers by restructuring the resource loading of mobile Web apps Re WAP is based on an ec ent mechanism of resource packaging where stable resources are encapsulated and maintained into package and such packages hall be loaded always from the local storage and updated by explicitly refreshing By retrieving and analyzing the update of resources Re WAP maintains resource packages that can accurately identify which resources can be loaded from the local storage for considerably long period Re WAP also provides wrapper for mobile Web apps to enable loading and updating resource packages in the local storage as well as loading resources from resource packages Re WAP can be easily and seamlessly deployed into existing mobile Web architectures with minimal modi cations and is transparent to end users We evaluate Re WAP based on continuous day access traces of mobile Web apps that sue heavily from the problem of redundant transfers Compared to the original mobile Web apps with cache enabled Re WAP can sign cant ly reduce the data tra with the median saving up to In addition Re WAP can incur only very minor runtime overhead of the client side browsers

Accepted for publication in Astronomy and Geophysics The use of Extraterrestrial Resources to Facilitate Space Science and Exploration Ian Crawford Martin Elvis and James Carpenter Department of Earth and Planetary Sciences Birk beck College London UK Harvard Smithsonian Center for Astrophysics Cambridge Massachusetts USA ESA ESTE Noord wijk The Netherlands Meeting Report Ian Crawford Martin Elvis and James Carpenter summarize Royal Astronomical Society Specialist Discussion Meeting which examined how science will benefit from the use of extraterrestrial resources To date all human economic activity has depended on the resources of single planet and it has long been recognized that developments in space exploration could in principle open our closed planetary economy to external resources of energy and raw materials Recently there has been renewed interest in these possibilities with several private companies established with the stated aim of exploiting extraterrestrial resources Space science and exploration are among the potential beneficiaries of space resources because their use may permit the construction and operation of scientific facilities in space that will be un affordable if all the required material and energy resources have to be lifted out of Earth's gravity Examples may include the next generation of large space telescopes sample return missions to the outer Solar System and human research stations on the Moon and Mars These potential scientific benefits of extraterrestrial resource util is ation were the topic of Specialist Discussion meeting held at Burlington House on April Martin Elvis Harvard Smithsonian Center for Astrophysics got the meeting underway by asking What can space resources do for astronomy Martin made the point that in order to observe the distant Universe or make detailed studies of planets around other stars astronomers will require larger telescopes in space across the electromagnetic spectrum but these are currently un affordable The aging Great Observatories Chandra HST and Spitzer will soon come to an end and although the infra red capabilities of Spitzer will be taken over and enhanced by the ST from the cost of just this one telescope will have consumed almost two decades worth of NASA available funding for large astrophysics missions The prospects for providing simultaneous coverage at other wavelengths with comparable instruments or building the much larger instruments that will be required for example to resolve surface features on Earth sized exoplanets Fig seem bleak based on existing funding models As the cost of large space telescopes and also of planetary missions increases much faster than economic growth funding wall will soon be encountered effectively ending the growth in space astronomy to which we have become accustomed Martin therefore argued that change in paradigm is required The astronomy community should exploit syne gies with the emerging new space entrepreneurs who are seeking to reduce launch costs develop space tourism and mine the Moon and asteroids for profitable materials Elvis Within years these commercial activities should cut mission costs significantly and

resource potential cid Estimation of service sector demand impact in die rent time and weather conditions Abstract Urban areas consist of mix of households and services such as ces shops schools etc Yet most urban energy models only consider household load roles omitting the service sector Re ali stic assessment of the potential for renewable resource integration in cities requires models that service sector This paper addresses this gap The paper proposes novel approach to devise synthetic service sector demand roles based on combination of large number of die rent data sources and uses estimations that are up to higher than if only households are considered The results can be used by researchers to improve urban energy systems models and by decision makers and practitioners for grid
