Capacity Price Game for Uncertain Renewables Resources Pan Li Shreyas Sekar Member IEEE and Bao sen Zhang Member IEEE this Abstract Renewable resources are starting to constitute growing portion of the total generation mix of the power system key difference between renewables and traditional generators is that many renewable resources are managed by individuals especially in the distribution system In this paper we study the capacity investment and pricing problem where multiple renewable producers compete in decentralized market It is known that most deterministic capacity games tend to result in very in efc ien te qui libri even when there area large number of similar players In contrast we show that due to the inherent randomness of renewable resources the qui libri in our capacity game becomes efc ent as the number of players grows and coincides with the centralized decision from the social planners problem This result provides new perspective on how to look at the positive in en ce of randomness in game framework as well as its contribution to resource planning scheduling and bidding We validate our results by simulation studies using real world data Index Terms Capacity game Nash equilibrium renewables generation cid

Graph Based Resource Allocation with Conic Avoidance for Broadcast Communications Luis ban to Leon Department of Electrical Engineering Eindhoven University of Technology Email ban to tue nl rie oppel aar XP Semiconductors Eindhoven Email rie oppel aar xp com Sonia He em stra de Groot Department of Electrical Engineering Eindhoven University of Technology Email she ems trade groot tue nl Abstract In this paper we present graph based resource allocation scheme for side link broadcast vehicle to vehicle communications Harnessing available information on the geographical position of vehicles and spectrum resources utilization eNo deBs are capable of allotting the same set of side link resources to several different vehicles in order for them to broadcast their signals Hence vehicles sharing the same resources would ideally be in different communications clusters for the interference level generated due to resource re purposing to be maintained under control Within communications cluster it is crucial that vehicles transmit in orthogonal time resources to prevent conic ts as vehicles with half duplex radio interfaces cannot transmit and receive simultaneously In this research we have envisaged solution based on bipartite graph where vehicles and spectrum resources are represented by vertices whereas the edges represent the achievable rate in each resource based on the signal to interference plus noise ratio IN that vehicles perceive The aforementioned constraint on time orthogonality of allocated resources can be approached by aggregating conic ting vertices into macro vertices which in addition narrows the search space yielding solution with computational complexity equivalent to the conventional graph matching problem We show mathematically and through simulations that the proposed approach yields an optimal solution In addition we provide simulations

The rst law of general quantum resource theories Carlo Spar ciar Ldi del Rio Carlo Maria can do lo Philippe Fai st and Jonathan Oppenheim Department of Physics and Astronomy University College London London WC BT United Kingdom Institute for Theoretical Physics ETH Zurich Zurich Switzerland Department of Computer Science University of Oxford Oxford OX QD UK Dahlem Center for Complex Quantum Systems Freie Universitat Berlin Berlin Germany Institute for Quantum Information and Matter Caltech Pasadena CA USA We extend the tools of quantum resource theories to scenarios in which multiple quant ties or resources are present and their interplay governs the evolution of physical systems We derive conditions for the inter conversion of these resources which general is the rst law of thermodynamics We study ever sibi lit conditions for multi resource theories and nd that the relative entropy distances from the invariant sets of the theory play fund mental role in the quant cation of the resources The rst law for general multi resource theories is single relation which links the change in the properties of the system during state transformation and the weighted sum of the resources exchanged In fact this law can be seen as relating the change in the relative entropy from die rent sets of states In contrast to typical single resource theories the notion of free states and invariant sets of states become distinct in light of multiple constraints Additionally generalisations of the Helmholtz free energy and of adiabatic and isothermal transformations emerge We thus have set of laws for general quantum resource theories which general is the laws of the mo dynamics We rst test this approach on thermodynamics with multiple conservation laws and then apply it to the theory of local operations under energetic restrictions Contents

Thermal Energy Grid Storage Using Multi junction Photovoltaics Caleb Amy Hamid Reza Sey Myles Steiner Daniel Friedman As gun Henry Department of Mechanical Engineering Massachusetts Institute of Technology Cambridge MA USA George Woodruff School of Mechanical Engineering Georgia Institute of Technology Atlanta GA USA National Renewable Energy Laboratory Golden CO USA Abstract As the cost of renewable energy falls below fossil fuels the most important challenge to enable widespread sustainable power generation has become making renewables dispatch able Low cost energy storage can provide this dispatch ability but there is no clear technology that can meet the need Pumped hydroelectric and compressed air storage have low costs but they are geographically constrained Similarly lithium ion batteries are becoming ubiquitous but even their lower bounding asymptote cost is too high to enable cost competitive dispatch able renewables Here we introduce concept based on thermal energy grid storage TE GS using multi junction photovoltaic heat engine MPV with promising initial experimental results that could meet the low cost required to enable cost competitive dispatch able renewables The approach exploits an important tradeoff between the accession of an extremely low cost per unit energy stored by storing heat instead of electricity directly while paying the penalty of lower round trip efficiency To understand why this tradeoff is advantageous we first introduce framework for evaluating storage technologies that treats round trip efficiency RTE as variable in addition to cost per unit energy stored CPE and cost per unit power CPP It is from this perspective that the TE GS MPV concept offers compelling economic proposition

Trautmann Carol in Wagner Bernd Hell in gra the Adriano Pol of Institute of Mathematics and Statistics University of So Paulo So Paulo SP Brazil Department of Obstetrics and Gynecology So Paulo University Medical School So Paulo SP Brazil Information Systems and Statistics University of nster nster Germany Institute of Mathematics Federal University of Mato Grosso do Sul Campo Grande MS Brazil Information Systems and Supply Chain Management University of nster nster Germany Western Australia University Perth Australia Abstract In system there are identical replaceable components working for given task and failed component is replaced by functioning one in the corresponding position which characterizes repairable system Assuming that replaced component lifetime has the same lifetime distribution as the old one single component position can be represented by renewal process and the multiple components positions for single system form super posed renewal process When the interest consists in estimating the component lifetime distribution there are considerable amount of works that deal with estimation methods for this kind of problem However the information about the exact position of the replaced component is not avail able that is masked cause of failure In this work we propose two methods Bayesian and maximum likelihood function approaches for estimating the failure time distribution of components in repairable system with masked cause of failure As our proposed estimators consider latent variables they yield better performance results compared to commonly used estimators from the literature The proposed mod els are generic and straightforward for any probability distribution Aside from point estimates interval ar estimates are presented for both approaches Using several simulations the performances of the proposed methods are illustrated and their ec ien cy and applicability are shown based on the so called cylinder problem Keywords Bayesian paradigm component lifetime EM algorithm Markov Chain Monte Carlo maximum likelihood estimator Metropolis within Gibbs algorithm parametric estimation repairable system series system Pre print submitted to to the chosen journal June

Optimal Exploitation of Resource with Stochastic Population Dynamics and Delayed Renewal Idris Khar rou bi Thomas Lim Va than Ly Va th Sorbonne Universit ENS II ENS II LPS La MME La MME CNRS MR CNRS MR CNRS MR idris khar rou bi up mc fr lim ens ii fr ly va th ens ii fr September Abstract In this work we study the optimization problem of renewable resource in nite time The resource is assumed to evolve according to logistic stochastic dieren ti al equation The manager may harvest partially the resource at any time and sell it at stochastic market price She may equally decide to renew part of the resource but uniquely at deterministic times However we realistically assume that there is delay in the renewing order By using the dynamic programming theory we may obtain the DE characterization of our value function To complete our study we give an algorithm to compute the value function and optimal strategy Some numerical illustrations will be equally provided Key words impulse control renewable resource optimal harvesting execution delay viscosity solutions states constraints MSC Classic ation The research of the author bene ted from the support of the French AN research grant LI QUI RISK The research of the author bene ted from the support of the Chair March een mutation Federation Banca ire Francaise The research of the author bene ted from the support of the Chair March een mutation Federation Banca ire Francaise

Punishment and inspection for governing the commons in feedback evolving game Xiao jie Chen and Attila Szolnok School of Mathematical Sciences University of Electronic Science and Technology of China Chengdu China Institute of Technical Physics and Materials Science Centre for Energy Research Hungarian Academy of Sciences Box Budapest Hungary xiao jie chen est edu cn szolnok mfa kf ki hu Abstract Utilizing common resources is always dilemma for community members While co operator players restrain themselves and consider the proper state of resources defectors demand more than their supposed share for higher payoff To avoid the tragedy of the common state punishing the latter group seems to be an adequate reaction This conclusion however is less straightforward when we acknowledge the fact that resources are finite and even renewable resource has limited growing capacity To clarify the possible consequences we consider co evolutionary model where beside the payoff driven competition of co operator and defector players the level of renewable resource depends sensitively on the fraction of co operators and the total consumption of all players The applied feedback evolving game reveals that beside delicately adjusted punishment it is also fundamental that co operators should pay special attention to the growing capacity of renewable resources Otherwise even the usage of tough punishment cannot save the community from an undesired end Author summary Our proposed model considers not only the fundamental dilemma of individual and collective benefits but also focuses on their impacts on the environmental state In general there is strong interdependence between individual actions and the actual shape of environment that can be described by means of co evolutionary model Such approach recognizes the fact that even if our common pool resources are partly renewable they have limited growth capacities hence depleted environment is unable to recover and reach sustainable level again This scenario would have dramatic consequence on our whole society therefore we should avoid it by punishing those who are not exercising restrain We provide analytical and numerical evidences which highlight that punishment alone may not necessarily be powerful tool to maintain healthy shape of environment for the benefit of future generations Co operator actors who are believed to take care of present state of our environment should also consider carefully the growth capacity of renewable resources PLO

Operational Advantage of Quantum Resources in Sub channel Discrimination Ryuji Takagi Bar to sz Re gul Kai feng Bu Zi Wen Liu and Gerardo desso Center for Theoretical Physics and Department of Physics Massachusetts Institute of Technology Cambridge Massachusetts USA School of Mathematical Sciences and Centre for the Mathematics and Theoretical Physics of Quantum Non Equilibrium Systems University of Nottingham University Park Nottingham NG RD United Kingdom School of Physical and Mathematical Sciences Nanyang Technological University Singapore Complexity Institute Nanyang Technological University Singapore School of Mathematical Sciences Zhejiang University Hangzhou Peoples Republic of China Department of Physics Harvard University Cambridge Massachusetts USA Perimeter Institute for Theoretical Physics Waterloo Ontario Canada One of the central problems in the study of quantum resource theories is to provide given resource with an operational meaning characterizing physical tasks in which the resource can give an explicit advantage over all resource less states We show that this can always be accomplished for all convex resource theories We establish in particular that any resource state enables an advantage in channel discrimination task allowing for strictly greater success probability than any state without the given resource Furthermore wend that the generalized robustness measure serves as an exact quan tier for the maximal advantage enabled by the given resource state in class of sub channel discrimination problems providing universal operational interpretation to this fundamental resource quan tier We also consider wider range of sub channel discrimination tasks and show that the generalized robustness still serves as the operational advantage quan tier for several well known theories such as entanglement coherence and magic

Dynamic Resource Allocation in the Cloud with Near Optimal Ec ien cy Sebastian Perez Salazar Is hai Men ache Moh it Singh Alejandro Tori ello January Abstract Cloud computing has motivated renewed interest in resource allocation problems with new consumption models common goal is to share resource such as CPU or bandwidth among distinct users with die rent demand patterns as well as die rent quality of service re quire ment To ensure these service requirements cloud oe rings often come with service level agreement SLA between the provider and the users An SLA species the amount of are source user is entitled to utilize In many cloud settings providers would like to operate resources at high utilization while simultaneously respecting individual LAs There is typically trade between these two objectives for example utilization can be increased by shifting away resources from idle users to scavenger workload but with the risk of the former then becoming active again We study this fundamental trade by formulating resource allocation model that captures basic properties of cloud computing systems including LAs highly limited feedback about the state of the system and variable and unpredictable input sequences Our main result is simple and practical algorithm that achieves near optimal performance on the above two objectives First we guarantee nearly optimal utilization of the resource even if compared to the omniscient in dynamic optimum Second we simultaneously satisfy all individual LAs up to small error The main algorithmic tool is multiplicative weight update algorithm and primal dual argument to obtain its guarantees We also provide numerical validation on real data to demonstrate the performance of our algorithm in practical applications Key words Cloud Computing Online Algorithms

Moderate deviation analysis of major is ation based resource inter conversion Christopher Chubb Marco Toma michel and Kamil Kor ze kwa Centre for Engineered Quantum Systems School of Physics University of Sydney Sydney NSW Australia Centre for Quantum Software and Information School of Software University of Technology Sydney Sydney NSW Australia We consider the problem of inter converting nite amount of resources within all theories whose single shot transformation rules are based on major is ation relation the resource theories of entanglement and coherence for pure state transformations as well as thermodynamics for energy incoherent transformations When only nite resources are available we expect to see non trivial trade between the rate rn at which copies of are source state can be transformed into rn copies of another resource state and the error level of the inter conversion process as function of In this work we derive the optimal trade in the so called moderate deviation regime where the rate of inter conversion rn approaches its optimum in the asymptotic limit of unbounded resources while the error vanishes in the same limit We nd that the moderate deviation analysis exhibits resonance behaviour which implies that certain pairs of resource states can be inter converted at the asymptotically optimal rate with negligible error even in the nite regime

CIG RE US National Committee rue Artois PARIS Grid of the Future Symposium http www cig re org Dynamic Solar Hosting Capacity Calculations in Micro grids HOSSEINI KHO DAE PAA SO HOSS AN LE LI University of Denver ComE USA USA SUMMARY Micro grids as small scale island able power systems are considered as viable pro motors of renewable energy resources In particular micro grids can efficiently integrate solar photovoltaic PV as the deployment of this customer deployed technology is growing in distribution grids However there is limit on how much PV can be hosted by micro grid High penetration of PVs can potentially put the micro grid at operational risks including but not limited to over and under voltages excessive line losses overloading of transformers and feeders and protection failure To avoid such potential negative impacts the concept of hosting capacity is introduced and used The hosting capacity is defined as the total capacity of DER that can be integrated into given feeder micro grid without exceeding operational restrictions and or requiring system upgrades Hosting capacity studies are primarily done based on steady state analyses However in case of micro grids and when transitioning between grid connected and is landed modes dynamic operation becomes more restrictive than steady state operation and thus is worthy of detailed investigation to provide better understanding of the amount of DER that the micro grid can host This paper examines this problem and provides extensive simulations on practical test system to show its importance and merits KEYWORDS Hosting capacity Photovoltaic PV micro grid solar Zohreh Hosseini du edu

decomposition framework with implicit decision rules is proposed and the formulation scale is small Sub problems in the decomposition framework have time decoupled structure and are easy to solve numerical example is given to clarify the difference between two stage robustness and multi stage robustness bus system is tested and the effectiveness and efficiency of the proposed method are verified ABSTRACT With the integration of large scale renewable energy sources to power systems many optimization methods have been applied to solve the stochastic uncertain transmission constrained unit commitment TCU problem Among all methods two stage and multi stage robust optimization based methods are the most widely adopted ones In the two stage methods non antic ip at iv it of economic dispatch ED decisions are not considered While in multi stage methods explicit decision rules for example affine decision rules are usually adopted to guarantee non antic ip at iv it of ED decisions With explicit decision rules the computational burden can be heavy and the optimal it of the solution is affected In this paper multi stage robust TCU formulation with implicit decision rules is proposed as well as decomposition framework to solve it The solutions are proved to be multi stage robust and non antic ip at iv it of ED decisions is guaranteed Meanwhile com put ation ally efficient time decoupled solution method for the feasibility check sub problems is also proposed such that the method is suitable for large scale TCU problems with uncertain loads renewable injections Numerical tests are con duct ed on the IEEE bus system and Polish bus system Performances of several state of the art methods are compared KEYWORDS OR in energy Unit commitment Multi stage robust optimization Decomposition approach Non antic ip at ive constraints ACKNOWLEDGMENTS This work is supported in part by National Key Project FB National Natural Science Foundations of China

PE Distributed Mixed Voltage Angle and Frequency Droop Control of Micro grid Interconnections with Loss of Distribution PM Measurements Siva ran jani Et ika Agar wal Vijay Gupta Pano Ants klis and Le Xie Recent advances in distribution level has or measurement unit PM technology have enabled the use of voltage phase angle measurements for direct load sharing control in distribution level micro grid interconnections with high penetration of renewable distributed energy resources DER In particular PM enabled voltage angle droop control has the potential to enhance stability and transient performance in such micro grid interconnections However these angle droop control designs are vulnerable to PM angle measurement losses that frequently occur due to the un availability of global positioning system GPS signal for synchronization In the event of such measurement losses angle droop controlled micro grid interconnections may suffer from poor performance and potentially lose stability In this paper we propose novel distributed mixed voltage angle and frequency droop control AFD framework to improve the reliability of angle droop controlled micro grid interconnections In this framework when the PM phase angle measurement is lost at micro grid conventional frequency droop control is temporarily used for primary control in place of angle droop control to guarantee stability We model the micro grid interconnection with this primary control architecture as nonlinear switched system and design distributed secondary controllers to guarantee stability of the network Further we incorporate performance spec cations such as robustness to generation load mismatch and network topology changes in the distributed control design We demonstrate the performance of this control framework by simulation on test feeder distribution network Index Terms Micro grids has or measurement units interconnected system stability distribution systems droop control

The role of hydro power storage and transmission in the de carbon iz ation of the Chinese power system Hai liang Liu Tom Brown Gorm Bru un Andresen David Schl acht berger Martin reiner Department of Engineering Aarhus University Inge Lehmann Gade Aarhus Denmark Institute for Automation and Applied Informatics Karlsruhe Institute of Technology Eggen stein Leopold sha fen Germany Abstract Deep de carbon iz ation of the electricity sector can be provided by high penetration of renewable sources such as wind solar PV and hydro power Flexibility from hydro and storage complements the high temporal variability of wind and solar and transmission infrastructure helps the power balancing by moving electricity in the spatial dimension We study cost optimal highly renewable Chinese power systems under ambitious CO emission reduction targets by deploying node hourly resolved techno economic optimization model supported by validated weather converted year long renewable power generation and electricity demand data set With new realistic reservoir hydro model we nd that if CO emission reduction goes beyond storage facilities such as hydro battery and hydrogen become necessary for moderate system cost Numerical results show that the see xi bil it components can lower renewable curtailment by two thirds allow higher solar PV share by factor of two and contribute to covering summer cooling demand We show that expanding unidirectional high voltage DC lines on top of the regional inter connections is technically ufc ent and more economical than ultra high voltage AC connected One Net grid Finally constraining transmission volume from the optimum by up to does not push total costs much higher while the sign cant need for battery storage remains even with abundant inter connectivity Keywords China de carbon iz ation large scale integration of renewables hydropower wind power storage Email address LL eng au dk Hai liang Liu Pre print submitted to Applied Energy February

Operational planning and bidding for district heating systems with uncertain renewable energy production Ignacio Blanco Daniela Guericke Anders Andersen and Henrik Madsen Technical University of Denmark Department for Applied Mathematics and Computer Science Richard Petersen lads Kgs Lyngby Denmark EMD International Niels Jer nes ve Aalborg Denmark Corresponding author Daniela Guericke ng tu dk June Abstract In countries with an extended use of district heating DH the in te grated operation of DH and power systems can increase the ex bil it of the power system achieving higher integration of renewable energy sources RES DH operators cannot only provide ex bil it to the power system by acting on the electricity market but also prot from the situ tion to lower the overall system cost However the operational planning and bidding includes several uncertain components at the time of plan ning electricity prices as well as heat and power production from RES In this publication we propose planning method that supports DH op era tors by scheduling the production and creating bids for the day ahead and balancing electricity markets The method is based on stochastic pro ramming and extends bidding strategies for virtual power plants to the DH application The uncertain factors are considered explicitly through scenario generation We apply our solution approach to real case study in Denmark and perform an extensive analysis of the production and trading behaviour of the DH system The analysis provides insights on how DH system can provide regulating power as well as the impact of uncertainties and renewable sources on the planning Furthermore the case study shows the be net in terms of cost reductions from considering portfolio of units and both markets to adapt to RES production and market states Keywords District heating Bidding method Stochastic program ming Operational planning Day ahead electricity market Balancing mar ket

ELSA Ec ent Long Term Secure Storage of Large Datasets Full Version cid Matthias Ge ihs and Johannes Buch mann TU Darmstadt Germany Abstract An increasing amount of information today is generated exchanged and stored digitally This also includes long lived and highly sensitive information electronic health records governmental documents whose integrity and conde nti ali ty must be protected over decades or even centuries While there is vast amount of cryptography based data protection schemes only few are designed for long term protection Recently Braun et al Asia CCS proposed the rst long term protection scheme that provides renewable in te grit protection and information theoretic conde nti ali ty protection However com put tion and storage costs of their scheme increase sign cant ly with the number of stored data items As result their scheme appears suitable only for protecting databases with small number of relatively large data items but unsuitable for databases that hold large number of relatively small data items medical record databases In this work we present solution for ec ent long term integrity and conde nti ali ty pro tec tion of large datasets consisting of relatively small data items First we construct re new able vector commitment scheme that is information theoretically hiding under selective de commitment We then combine this scheme with renewable time stamps and information theoretically secure secret sharing The resulting solution requires only single timestamp for protecting data set while the state of the art requires number of time stamps linear in the number of data items We implemented our solution and measured its performance in scenario where data items are aggregated stored protected and ve ried over time span of years Our measurements show that our new solution completes this evaluation scenario an order of magnitude faster than the state of the art

Robust MPC for temperature management on electrical transmission lines Clementine Strau or in Ola ru Jean Mae gh Patrick Pan cia tic Laboratory of Signals and Systems Centrale Su pele Universit Paris clay France mail rst name lastname centrale su pele fr French transmission system operator Re seau de Transport dE lectricit RTE mail rst name lastname rte france com Abstract In the current context of high integration of renewable energies maximizing infrastructures capabilities for electricity transmission is general need for Transmission System Operators TSO The French TSO RTE is developing levers to control power ow in real time renewable production curtailment is already employed and large battery storage systems are planned to be installed for congestion management in early The combination of these levers with the use of Dynamic Line Rating DLR helps exploiting the lines at the closest of their limit by managing their temperature in real time Unnecessary margins can be reduced avoiding congestion and excessive generation curtailment In particular there is possible interesting correlation between the transits increase due to high wind farms generation and the cooling eec of wind on power lines in the same area In order to optimize the electrical transmission network capacities the present paper advocates the use of temperature management model mixing production curtailment and large batteries as control variables robust Model Predictive Control framework for local control on electrical lines temperature is presented based on the regulation within tubes of trajectories Simulations on the French electrical network are conducted to show the eec ti ve ness of the optimization based control design Keywords Robust MPC power systems congestion management dynamic line rating batteries

JS Signature Eliminating Third Party Hosted JavaScript Infection Threats Using Digital Signatures Kou sha Nak hae brahim Ansari and Fate me Ansari Mouse Stats Analytics Inc Vancouver BC Canada mouse stats com https kou sha ca Charles University Faculty of Mathematics and Physics Institute of Formal and Applied Linguistics Department of Computer Science and Information Technology Institute for Advanced Studies in Basic Sciences SBS Zanj an Iran ansari ansari sbs ac ir https sbs ac ir ansari Abstract Today third party JavaScript resources are indispensable part of the web platform More than of worlds top websites include at least one JavaScript resource from remote host However there is great security risk behind using third party JavaScript resource if an attacker can infect one of these remote JavaScript resources all websites those have included the script would be at risk In this paper we present JS Signature an entirely at the client side pure JavaScript framework in order to validate third party JavaScript resources using digital signature Therefore all included JavaScript resources are checked against the integrity authentication and non repudiation risks before the execution In contrary to existing methods JS Signature pro tec ts web pages regardless of third party resource infection nature while it does not set any restrictions on trusted JavaScript providers This approach has an acceptable one time performance overhead and is an easily deploy able add in We have validated the proposed solution by applying tests on an implemented version Keywords Web Application Security Digital Signature Security Architecture Script Inclusion

Optimal Energy Management for Commercial Buildings Considering Comprehensive Comfort Levels in Retail Electricity Market Zhe ming Liang De song Bian Xiao hu Zhang Di Shia Rui sheng Diao Zhi wei Wang aGE IRI North America San Jose CA USA Department of Electrical and Computer Engineering University of Michigan Dearborn MI USA Abstract Demand response has been implemented by distribution system operators to reduce peak demand and mitigate contingency issues on distribution lines and substations Spec ic ally the campus based commercial buildings make the major contributions to peak demand in distribution system Note that prior works neglect the consumers comfort level in per forming demand response which limits their applications as the incentives are not worth as compared to the loss in comfort levels for most time Thus framework to com pre hen siv ely consider both operating costs and comfort levels is necessary Moreover distributed energy resources are widely deployed in commercial buildings such as roof top solar panels plug in electric vehicles and energy storage units which bring various uncertainties to the distribution systems output of renewables ii electricity prices iii arrival and departure of plug in electric vehicles iv business hour demand response signals and ex ble energy demand In this paper we propose an optimal demand response framework to enable local control of demand side appliances that are usually too small to participate in retail electricity market Several typical small demand side appliances heating vent la tion and air conditioning systems electric water heaters and plug in electric vehicles are considered in our proposed model Their operations are coordinated by central controller whose objective is to minimize the total cost and maximize the customers comfort levels for multiple commercial buildings scenario based stochastic programming is leveraged to handle the aforementioned uncertainties Numerical results based on the practical data demonstrate the eec ti ve ness of the proposed framework In addition the trade between the operation costs of commercial buildings and customers comfort levels is illustrated Keywords In en ce of technological progress and renew ability on the sustainability of ecosystem engineers populations Guilherme Lopes and Jose Fontana ri Instituto de sica de Sao Carlos Universidade de Sao Paulo aix Postal Sao Carlos Sao Paulo Brazil Overpopulation and environmental degradation due to inadequate resource use are outcomes of humans ecosystem engineering that has profoundly mo died the worlds landscape Despite the age old concern that unchecked population and economic growth maybe unsustainable the prospect of societal collapse remains contentious today Contrasting with the usual approach to modeling human nature interactions which are based on the Lot ka Volterra predator prey model with humans as the predators and nature as the prey here we address this issue using discrete time population dynamics model of ecosystem engineers The growth of the population of engineers is modeled by the everton Holt equation with density dependent carrying capacity that is proportional to the number of usable habitats These habitats farms are the products of the work of the in divi also the virgin habitats native forests hence the denomination engineers of ecosystems to those agents The human made habitats decay into degraded habitats which eventually regenerate into virgin habitats For slow regeneration resources wend that the dynamics is dominated by cy cles of prosperity and collapse in which the population reaches vanishing small densities However increase of the ec ien cy of the engineers to explore the resources eliminates the dangerous cyclical patterns of feast and famine and leads to as table equilibrium that balances population growth and resource availability This ding supports the viewpoint of growth optimists that technological progress may avoid collapse

Competition for Stem Cell Fate Determinants as Mechanism for Tissue Homeostasis David org Yu Kita date hosei Yoshida and Benjamin Simons Cavendish Laboratory Department of Physics University of Cambridge JJ Thomson Avenue Cambridge CB HE United Kingdom The Wellcome Trust Cancer Research UK Gurdon Institute University of Cambridge Tennis Court Road Cambridge CB United Kingdom Division of Germ Cell Biology National Institute for Basic Biology National Institutes of Natural Sciences Higashi yama yoda iji Okazaki Japan Department of Basic Biology School of Life Science Graduate University for Advanced Studies So ken dai Higashi yama yoda iji Okazaki Japan The Wellcome Trust Medical Research Council Stem Cell Institute University of Cambridge Cambridge CB QR United Kingdom Stem cells maintain tissues by generating dieren tia ted cell types while simultaneously self renewing their own population The mechanisms that allow stem cell populations to function collectively to control their density maintain robust homeostasis and recover from injury remain elusive Motivated by recent experimental advances here we develop generic and robust mechanism of stem cell self renewal based on competition for diu sib le fate determinants which exert fate control Using both analytical methods and stochastic simulations we show that the mechanism is characterized by signature dynamic and statistical properties from stem cell density uc tu at ions and transient large scale oscillation dynamics during recovery to scaling cl on al dynamics front like boundary propagation and features of dynamical quantization of self renewal zones in localized domains Based on these dings we suggest that competition for fate determinants provides generic and robust mechanism by which stem cells can self organize to achieve density homeostasis in an open or facultative niche environment

Resource Allocation in Green Dense Cellular Networks Complexity and Algorithms Zo ube ir lika El mahdi Dr ouch and Wes sam jib Abstract This paper studies the problem of user association scheduling and channel allocation in dense cellular networks with energy harvesting base stations EBS In this problem the EBS are powered solely by renewable energy and each user has request for downloading data of certain size with deadline constraint The objective is to maximize the number of associated and scheduled users while allocating the available channels to the users and respecting the energy and deadline constraints First the computational complexity of this problem is characterized by studying it sNP hardness in different cases Next efc ent algorithms are proposed in each case The case of single channel and single EBS is solved using two polynomial time optimal algorithms one for arbitrary deadlines and less complex one for common deadlines The case of single channel and multiple EBS is solved by proposing an efc ent constant factor approximation algorithm The case of multiple channels is efc ent ly solved using heuristic algorithm Finally our theoretical analysis is supplemented by simulation results to illustrate the performance of the proposed algorithms Index Terms User association scheduling channel allocation energy harvesting approximation algorithms NP hardness

Article When Energy Trading meets Block chain in Electrical Power System The State of the Art Nai yu Wang Xiao Zhou in Lu Zhi tao Guan Long fei Wu Xiao jiang Du and Mohsen Gui zan School of Control and Computer Engineering North China Electric Power University Beijing China shininess com Department of Mathematics and Computer Science Fayetteville State University Fayetteville NC USA wu unc fsu edu Department of Computer and Information Science Temple University Philadelphia PA USA dx ieee org Electrical and Computer Engineering Department University of Idaho Moscow ID USA gui zan gmail com Correspondence guan ncep edu cn Abstract With the rapid growth of renewable energy resources the energy trading began to shift from centralized to distributed manner Block chain as distributed public ledger technology has been widely adopted to design new energy trading schemes However there are many challenging issues for block chain based energy trading low efficiency high transaction cost security privacy issues To tackle with the above challenges many solutions have been proposed In this survey the block chain based energy trading in electrical power system is thoroughly investigated Firstly the challenges in block chain based energy trading are identified Then the existing energy trading schemes are studied and classified into three categories based on their main focus energy transaction consensus mechanism and system optimization And each category is presented in detail Although existing schemes can meet the specific energy trading requirements there are still many unsolved problems Finally the discussion and future directions are given Keywords Energy trading Block chain Electrical Power System

Non renewal statistics in quantum transport through the eyes of rst passage and waiting time distributions Samuel Rud ge and Daniel Kos ov College of Science and Engineering James Cook University Townsville QLD Australia The waiting time distribution has in recent years proven to be useful statistical tool for character ising transport in nano scale quantum transport In particular as opposed to moments of the distribution of transferred charge which have historically been calculated in the long time limit waiting times are able to detect non renewal behaviour in mes osco pic systems They have failed however to correctly incorporate back tunneling events Recently method has been developed that can describe unidirectional and bidirectional transport on an equal footing the distribution of rst passage times Rather than the time between successive electron tunnelings the rst passage refers to the rst time the number of extra electrons in the drain reaches Here we demonstrate the dieren ces between rst passage time statistics and waiting time statistics in transport scenarios where the waiting time either cannot correctly reproduce the higher order current cum ul ants or cannot be calculated at all To this end we examine electron transport through molecule coupled to two macroscopic metal electrodes We model the molecule with strong electron electron and electron ph on on interactions in three regimes sequential tunneling and co tunneling for nite bias voltage through the Anderson model ii sequential tunneling with no temperature gradient al and bias voltage through the Holstein model and iii sequential tunneling at zero bias voltage and temperature gradient through the Holstein model We show that for each transport scenario back tunneling events play sign cant role consequently the waiting time statistics do not correctly predict the renewal and non renewal behaviour whereas the rst passage time distribution does

Evolutionary framework for two stage stochastic resource allocation problems Pedro Ho kama Mario San Felice Ev and ro Brac htc Fabio Us berti Federal University of It juba UNI FEI It juba MG Brazil Federal University of Sao Carlos UF SCar Sao Carlos SP Brazil State University of Mato Grosso do Sul EMS Dour dos MS Brazil University of Campinas UNI CAMP Campinas SP Brazil Abstract Resource allocation problems are family of problems in which resources must be selected to satisfy given demands This paper focuses on the two stage stochastic generalization of resource allocation problems where future demands are expressed in nite number of possible scenarios The goal is to select cost eec ti ve resources to be acquired in the present time rst stage and to im ple ment complete solution for each scenario second stage while minimizing the total expected cost of the choices in both stages We propose an evolutionary framework for solving general two stages to chas tic resource allocation problems In each iteration of our framework local search algorithm selects resources to be acquired in the rst stage genetic meta heuristic then completes the solutions for each scenario and relevant in formation is passed on to the next iteration there by supporting the acquisition of promising resources in the following rst stage Experimentation on umer us instances of the two stage stochastic Steiner tree problem suggests that our evolutionary framework is powerful enough to address large instances of wide variety of two stage stochastic resource allocation problems Keywords two stage stochastic problems local search genetic meta heuristic

GENEROSITY SELFISHNESS AND EXPLOITATION AS OPTIMAL GREEDY STRATEGIES FOR RESOURCE SHARING PRE PRINT An dreaM zz olin Quantitative life science Unit The Abdus Salam International Center for Theoretical Physics Trieste Italy maz zo li ict it Antonio Ce lani Quantitative life science Unit The Abdus Salam International Center for Theoretical Physics Trieste Italy ace lani ict it October ABSTRACT Resource sharing outside the kinship bonds is rare Besides humans it occurs in chimpanzee wild dogs and hyenas as well as in vampire bats Resource sharing is an instance of animal cooperation where an animal gives away part of the resources that it owns for the be net of recipient Taking inspiration from blood sharing in vampire bats here we show the emergence of generosity in Markov game which couples the resource sharing between two players with the gathering task of that resource At variance with the classical evolutionary models for cooperation the optimal strategies of this game can be potentially learned by animals during their life time The players act greedily that is they try to individually maximize only their personal income Nonetheless the analytical solution of the model shows that three nontrivial optimal behaviours emerge depending on conditions Besides the obvious case when players are sel shin their choice of resource division there are conditions under which both players are generous Moreover we also found range of situations in which one sel sh player exploits another generous individual for the satisfaction of both players Our results show that resource sharing is favoured by three factors along time horizon over which the players try to optimize their own game the similarity among players in their ability of performing the resource gathering task as well as by the availability of resources in the environment These concurrent requirements lead to identify necessary conditions for the emergence of generosity

Forecasting patio Temporal Renewable Scenarios Deep Generative Approach Cong mei Jiang ize Chen Yong fang Mao Yi Chai and Ming bia Yu Abstract The operation and planning of large scale power systems are becoming more challenging with the increasing penetration of stochastic renewable generation In order to minimize the decision risks in power systems with large amount of renewable resources there is growing need to model the short term generation uncertainty By producing group of possible future realization for certain set of renewable generation plants scenario approach has become one popular way for renewables uncertainty modeling However due to the complex spatial and temporal correlations underlying in renewable generations traditional model based approaches for forecasting future scenarios often require extensive knowledge while ted models are often hard to scale To address such modeling burdens we propose learning based data driven scenario forecasts method based on generative adversarial networks GANs which is class of deep learning generative algorithms used for modeling unknown distributions We rst ly utilize an improved GANs with convergence guarantees to learn the intrinsic patterns and model the unknown distributions of multiple site renewable generation time series Then by solving an optimization problem we are able to generate forecasted scenarios without any scenario number and forecasting horizon restrictions Our method is totally model free and could forecast scenarios under different level of forecast uncertainties Extensive numerical simulations using real world data from NREL wind and solar integration datasets validate the performance of proposed method in forecasting both wind and solar power scenarios Index Terms Art ici al intelligence renewable energy scenario generation unsupervised learning

Submitted to the Annals of Applied Statistics ar Xiv ar Xiv NOTE ON ESTIMATING OPTIMAL DYNAMIC TREATMENT STRATEGIES UNDER RESOURCE CONSTRAINTS USING DYNAMIC MARGINAL STRUCTURAL MODELS By Ellen Can glia Eleanor Murray Miguel Hernan and Zach hahn New York University School of Medicine Harvard Chan School of Public Health and IBM Research Existing strategies for determining the optimal treatment or mon to ring strategy typically assume unlimited access to resources How ever when health system has resource constraints such as limited funds access to medication or monitoring capabilities medical dec ions must balance impacts on both individual and population health outcomes That is decisions should account for competition between individuals in resource usage One simple solution is to estimate the counter factual resource usage under the possible interventions and choose the optimal strategy for which resource usage is within accept able limits We propose method to identify the optimal dynamic intervention strategy that leads to the best expected health outcome accounting for health systems resource constraints We then apply this method to determine the optimal dynamic monitoring strategy for people living with HIV when resource limits on monitoring exist using observational data from the HIV CAUSAL Collaboration

The Impact of Renewable Energy Forecasts on Intra day Electricity Prices Sergei Kul kov Florian Zi el Abstract In this paper we study the impact of errors in wind and solar power forecasts on intra day electricity prices We develop novel econometric model which is based on day ahead wholesale auction curves data and errors in wind and solar power forecasts The model shifts day ahead supply curves to calculate intra day prices We apply our model to the German EP EX SPOT SE data Our model outperforms both linear and non linear benchmarks Our study allows us to conclude that errors in renewable energy forecasts exert an on linear impact on intra day prices We demonstrate that additional wind and solar power capacities induce non linear changes in the intra day price volatility Finally we comment on economical and policy implications of our dings Keywords Energy economics Energy forecasting Energy Policy Forecasting and Pre dic tion Methods Renewable Resources EL

Estimation of the Shapley Value of Peer to Peer Energy Sharing Game using cid Coalition al Stra tied Random Sampling Li yang Han Thomas Mors ty Malcolm McCulloch Department of Engineering Science University of Oxford UK mail li yang han thomas mors ty malcolm mcculloch eng ox ac uk Abstract Various peer to peer energy markets have emerged in recent years in an attempt to manage distributed energy resources in more ec ent way One of the main challenges these models face is how to create and allocate incentives to participants Cooperative game theory ers methodology to nanci ally reward pro sumer based on their contributions made to the local energy coalition using the Shapley value but its high computational complexity limits the size of the game This paper explores astra tied sampling method proposed in existing literature for Shapley value estimation and mo dies the method for peer to peer cooperative game to improve its cal ability Finally selected case studies verify the eec ti ve ness of the proposed coalition al stra tied random sampling method and demonstrate results from large games Keywords energy sharing cooperative game theory Shapley value energy management energy storage ex ble demand see Saj jade tal This paper makes the common assumption that the price to export energy

Energy Storage Management via Deep Networks Ahmed Zam zam Bo Yang and Nicholas Sidi ro poul os Abstract Energy storage devices represent environmentally friendly candidates to cope with volatile renewable energy generation Motivated by the increase in privately owned storage systems this paper studies the problem of real time control of storage unit co located with renewable energy generator and an inelastic load Unlike many approaches in the literature no distribution al assumptions are being made on the renewable energy generation or the real time prices Building on the deep networks algorithm reinforcement learning approach utilizing neural network is devised where the storage unit operational constraints are respected The neural network approximates the action value function which dictates what action charging discharging etc to take Simulations indicate that near optimal performance can be attained with the proposed learning based control policy for the storage units

Fleet wide data enabled reliability improvement of wind turbines Timothy Ver stra ten Ann Nowe Jonathan Keller Yi Guo Shu an gwen Sheng Jan He lse nb Art ici al Intelligence Lab Vrije Universit it russel Plein la an Brussels Belgium Acoustics Vibrations Research Group Vrije Universit it russel Plein la an Brussels Belgium cOW Lab Cel est ij nen la an Hever lee Belgium National Renewable Energy Laboratory National Wind Technology Center Golden CO USA Abstract Wind farms are an indispensable driver toward renewable and nonpolluting energy resources However as ideal sites are limited placement in remote and challenging locations results in higher logistics costs and lower average wind speeds Therefore it is critical to increase the reliability of the turbines to reduce maintenance costs Robust implementation requires thorough understanding of the loads subject to the turbines control Yet such dy nami call changing multidimensional loads are uncommon with other ma chi nery and generally under researched Therefore multi tiered approach is proposed to investigate the load spectrum occurring in wind farms Our approach relies on both fundamental research using controllable test rigs as well as analyses of real world loading conditions in high frequency super vi so ry control and data acquisition data method is introduced to detect operational zones in wind farm data and link them with load distributions Additionally while focused research further investigates the load spectrum method is proposed that continuously optimizes the farms control protocols without the need to fully understand the loads that occur case of gearbox failure is investigated based on vast body of past experiments and suspect Corresponding author Email addresses ivers tr vu be Timothy Ver stra ten jah else vu be Jan Hel sen Pre print submitted to Renewable and Sustainable Energy Reviews Copyright cid Licensed under the Creative Commons CC BY NC ND

University of Massachusetts Amherst soltani go ckel ec umass edu College of Information and Computer Sciences University of Massachusetts Amherst owsley amir cs umass edu Abstract Covert communication conceals the existence of the transmission from watchful adversary We consider the fundamental limits for covert communications via packet insertion over packet channels whose packet timings are governed by renewal process of rate Authorized transmitter Jack sends packets to authorized receiver Steve and covert transmitter Alice wishes to transmit packets to covert receiver Bob without being detected by watchful adversary Willie Willie cannot authenticate the source of the packets Hence he looks for statistical anomalies in the packet stream from Jack to Steve to attempt detection of unauthorized packet insertion First we consider special case where the packet timings are governed by Poisson process and we show that Alice can covertly insert packets for Bob in time interval of length conversely if Alice inserts she will be detected by Willie with high probability Then we extend our results to general renewal channels and show that in stream of packets transmitted by Jack Alice can covertly insert packets if she inserts packets she will be detected by Willie with high probability Keywords Covert Packet Insertion Covert Packet Communication Covert Wired Communication Covert Channel Low Probability of Detection LP Network Security Information Theory This work has been supported by the National Science Foundation under grants CCS and CNS and appeared in part at the Game Theoretic Framework for Resource Sharing in Clouds Fa he em Za far Kin Leung Don owsley Pri th wish Bas cid and An an th ram Swami Imperial College London University of Massachusetts Amherst cid BB Technologies Army Research Laboratory fa he em kin leung imperial ac uk owsley cs umass edu cid pri th wish bas ray the on com an an th ram swami civ mail mil Abstract Providing resources to different users or applications is fundamental to cloud computing This is challenging problem as cloud service provider may have in ufc ent resources to satisfy all user requests Furthermore allocating available resources optimal ly to different applications is also challenging Resource sharing among different cloud service providers can improve resource availability and resource utilization as certain cloud service providers may have free resources available that can be rented by other service providers However different cloud service providers can have different objectives or utilities Therefore there is need for framework that can share and allocate resources in an efc ent and effective way while taking into account the objectives of various service providers that results in multi objective optimization problem In this paper we present Cooperative Game Theory CGT based framework for resource sharing and allocation among different service providers with varying objectives that form coalition We show that the resource sharing problem can be modeled as an player canonical cooperative game with non transferable utility NTU and prove that the game is convex for monotonic non decreasing utilities We propose an algorithm that provides an allocation from the core hence guaranteeing Pareto optimal it We evaluate the performance of our proposed resource sharing framework in number of simulation settings and show that our proposed framework improves user satisfaction and utility of service providers

Rio Grande do Sul Brazil jakub jura sz dh se Submitted to Renewable and Sustainable Energy Reviews Abstract It is expected and regionally observed that energy demand will soon be covered by widespread deployment of renewable energy sources However the weather and climate driven energy sources are characterized by significant spatial and temporal variability One of the commonly mentioned solutions to overcome the mismatch between demand and supply provided by renewable generation is hybridization of two or more energy sources in single power station like wind solar solar hydro or solar wind hydro The operation of hybrid energy sources is based on the complementary nature of renewable sources Considering the growing importance of such systems and increasing number of research activities in this area this paper presents comprehensive review of studies which investigated analyzed quantified and utilized the effect of temporal spatial and patio temporal complement ari ty between renewable energy sources The review starts with brief overview of available research papers formulates detailed definition of major concepts summarizes current research directions and ends with prospective future research activities The review provides chronological and spatial information with regard to the studies on the complement ari ty concept Keywords non dispatch able energy sources reliability weather driven variability index Highlights Pearson correlation is most common metric of complement ari ty quant if cation Concept of complement ari ty is often mentioned but clear application is not provided Most research activities focus on Brazil Europe China and USA

Universitat Auto noma de Barcelona ES Bella terra Barcelona Spain Dated April We initiate the systematic study of resource theories of quantum channels of the dynamics that quantum systems undergo by completely positive maps in abstract Resources are in principle all maps from one quantum system to another but some maps are deemed free The free maps are supposed to satisfy certain axioms among them closure under tensor products under composition and free ness of the identity map the latter two say that the free maps form mono id The free maps act on the resources simply by tensor product and composition This generalizes the much studied resource theories of quantum states and abolishes the distinction between resources states and the free maps which act on the former leaving only maps divided into resource full and resource free ones We discuss the axiomatic framework of quantifying channel resources and show two general methods of constructing resource monotones of channels Furthermore we show that under mild regularity conditions each resource theory of quantum channels has distinguished monotone the robustness and its smoothed version generalizing the analogous concept in resource theories of states We give an operational interpretation of the log robustness as the amount of heat dissipation randomness required for resource erasure by random reversible free maps valid in broad classes of resource theories of quantum channels Technically this is based on an abstract version of the recent convex split lemma extended from its original domain of quantum states to ordered vector spaces with uci ent ly well behaved base norms which includes the case of quantum channels with diamond norm or variants there of Finally we remark on several key issues concerning the asymptotic theory RESOURCE THEORIES FROM STATES TO MAPS The paradigm of resource theories has been applied successfully to capture the essence of what is valuable and how to measure its value in scenarios where certain objects and transformations are considered relatively easy compared to others In resource theories this is idealized by considering some objects and transformations free meaning they maybe invoked unlimited ly in any situation Spec ic ally resource theories of quantum states where the objects are states of quantum systems undergoing free quantum channels have proved to be extremely successful in characterizing various quantum and other features of quantum states such as entanglement coherence thermal non equilibrium asymmetry related to conserved quantities by No ether theorem magic states etc There are also several general theories that unify the common features of resource theories of states It has been realized that the structure of resource theory can be formalized in much more abstract ways and thus applied to more general settings For instance Refs establish algebraic frameworks for resource theories where the resources can essentially be any mathematical object that has acomb in able structure In another direction del Rio et al have attempted to formalize resource theories of knowledge where rather than combining systems top down approach captures only subsystems of global entity Here rather than going all the way to these abstract structures we will explore more modest but for quantum mechanics highly important and distinguished NEW INSIGHTS INTO POSITION OPTIMIZATION OF WAVE ENERGY CONVERTERS USING HYBRID LOCAL SEARCH PRE PRINT Mehdi Nes hat Bradley Alexander Optimization and Logistics Group Optimization and Logistics Group School of Computer Science School of Computer Science The University of Adelaide The University of Adelaide Australia Australia mehdi nes hat adelaide edu au bradley alexander adelaide edu au Natal ii aY Ser gii en ko Markus Wagner School of Mechanical Engineering Optimization and Logistics Group The University of Adelaide School of Computer Science Australia The University of Adelaide natal ii ser gii en ko adelaide edu au Australia markus wagner adelaide edu au December ABSTRACT Renewable energy will play pivotal role in meeting global energy demand in future Of current renewable sources wave energy offers enormous potential for growth This research investigates the optimization of the placement of oscillating buoy type wave energy converters WEC This work explores the design of wave farm consisting of an array of fully submerged three tether buoys In wave farm buoy positions strongly determine the farms output Optimizing the buoy positions is challenging research problem due to complex and extensive interactions constructive and destructive between buoys This research is focused on maximizing the power output of the farm through the placement of buoys in size constrained environment This paper proposes new hybrid approach mixing local search using surrogate power model and numerical optimization We compare our hybrid method with other state of the art search methods in ve different wave scenarios ones implied irregular wave model and four real wave regimes Our methods out per form well known previous heuristic methods in terms of both quality of achieved solutions and the convergence rate of search in all tested wave regimes Keywords Renewable energy hybrid local search Evolutionary Algorithms position optimization Wave Energy Converters

Foundations Properties and Security Applications of Puzzles Survey ISRA MOHAMED ALI MAUR ANTONIO CA PRO LU ROBERTO DI PIETRO Division of Information and Computing Technology ICT College of Science and Engineering SE Hamad Bin Khalifa University HBK Doha Qatar is ali mail hbk edu qa mca pro lu mail hbk edu qa rdi pietro hbk edu qa Cryptographic algorithms have been used not only to create robust ciphertexts but also to generate cryptograms that contrary to the classic goal of cryptography are meant to be broken These cryptograms generally called puzzles require the use of certain amount of resources to be solved hence introducing cost that is often regarded as time delay though it could involve other metrics as well such as bandwidth These powerful features have made puzzles the core of many security protocols acquiring increasing importance in the IT security landscape The concept of puzzle has subsequently been extended to other types of schemes that do not use cryptographic functions such as CAPTCHA which are used to discriminate humans from machines Overall puzzles have experienced renewed interest with the advent of Bitcoin which uses CPU intensive puzzle as proof of work In this paper we provide comprehensive study of the most important puzzle construction schemes available in the literature categorizing them according to several attributes such as resource type verification type and applications We have redefined the term puzzle by collecting and integrating the scattered notions used in different works to coverall the existing applications Moreover we provide an overview of the possible applications identifying key requirements and different design approaches Finally we highlight the features and limitations of each approach providing useful guide for the future development of new puzzle schemes CCS Concepts General and reference Surveys and overviews Security and privacy Crypto rap hy ACM Reference format Isra Mohamed Ali Maur antonio Ca pro lu Roberto Di Pietro Foundations Properties and Security Applications of Puzzles Survey Article April pages DOI nnnn nn nnnn nn

High Performance Ternary Alkali Nitrides for Renewable Energy Applications Jib an Kang saba nik and Af tab Alam Department of Physics Indian Institute of Technology Bombay Pow Mumbai India Rapid decline in fossil fuel energy necessitates the immediate need for renewable energy resources Here were porta previously unexplored class of nitrides MN Na Rb Cs Nb Ta keeping renewable energy applications in mind Using detailed structure and stability analysis using rst principles simulation we discovered twelve such compounds few of which are already synthesized before which are chemically mechanically and dynamically stable These twelve com pounds were then evaluated for their suitability for three renewable energy applications photo voltaic ii water splitting and iii thermo electrics Careful analysis of electronic structure reveals high optical transition strength resulting in sharp rise in absorption This in turn yields high short circuit current and hence excellent solar ec ien cy for few compounds namely sVN and Rb Along with excellent absorption quality some compounds show favorable band edge positions com pared to water redox levels and hence are promising as photo electrodes in photo electro chemical water splitting devices Mixture of at and is per sive bands in the band structure yields both high See beck and electrical conductivity thus excellent power factor for six compounds Simulated lat tice thermal conductivity shows moderate to ultra low values and thus the possibility of achieving high thermo electric gu re of merit even at lower temperatures From the experimental per spec ti ve we discuss the possible challenges that may arise while utilizing these compounds for the desired applications and suggest possible pathways to overcome them We believe such theoretical prediction of promising materials are extremely useful for new materials discovery and anticipate rapid response from the experimental community

Generative Adversarial Networks for Operational Scenario Planning of Renewable Energy Farms Study on Wind and Photovoltaic Jens Schreiber Maik Jess ul at Bernhard Sick University of Kassel schreiber jess ul at sick uni kassel de Abstract For the integration of renewable energy sources power grid operators need realistic information about the eec ts of energy pro duc tion and consumption to assess grid stability Recently research in sce na rio planning be nets from utilizing generative adversarial networks GANs as generative models for operational scenario planning In these scenarios operators examine temporal as well as spatial in en ces of if fe rent energy sources on the grid The analysis of how renewable energy resources ect the grid enables the operators to evaluate the stability and to identify potential weak points such as limiting transformer However due to their novelty there are limited studies on how well GANs model the underlying power distribution This analysis is essen ti al because especially extreme situations with low or high power generation are required to evaluate grid stability We conduct com par at ive study of the Wasser stein distance binary cross entropy loss and Gaussian copula as the baseline applied on two wind and two solar datasets with limited data compared to previous studies Both GANs achieve good results considering the limited amount of data but the Wasser stein GAN is superior in modeling temporal and spatial relations and the power distribution Besides evaluating the generated power is tri but ion over all farms it is essential to assess terrain spec ic dist rib ions for wind scenarios These terrain spec ic power distributions ect the grid by their dieren ces in their generating power magnitude There fore in second study we show that even when simultaneously learning distributions from wind parks with terrain spec ic patterns GANs are capable of modeling these individual ties also when faced with limited data These results motivate further usage of GANs as generative mod els in scenario planning as well as other areas of renewable energy

tie hl Received date Accepted date Abstract Recent progress in genetic techniques has shed light on the complex co evolution of malignant cell clones in leukemias However several aspects of cl on al selection still remain unclear In this paper we present multi compartment al continuously structured population model of selection dyna ics in acute leukemias which consists of system of coupled in te gro dieren ti al equations Our model can be analysed in more ec ent way than classical models formulated in terms of ordinary dieren ti al equations Exploiting the analytical tract ability of this model we investigate how cl on al selection is shaped by the self renewal fraction and the proliferation rate of leuk emi cells at die rent maturation stages We integrate analytical results with numerical solutions of calibrated version of the model based on real patient data In summary our mathematical results formalise the biological notion that cl on al selection is driven by the self renewal fraction of leuk emi stem cells and the clones that possess the highest value of this parameter are ultimately selected Moreover we demonstrate that the self renewal fraction and the proliferation rate of non stem cells do not have substantial impact on cl on al selection Taken together our results indicate that inter cl on al variability in the self renewal fraction of leuk emi stem cells provides the necessary substrate for cl on al selection to act upon Tommaso Lorenz School of Mathematics and Statistics University of St Andrews North Haugh St Andrews Fife KY United Modelling and Simulation of of high efficiency Ga As PIN Solar Cell Ali Imran Deborah Eric Muhammad Noam an Zahid Muhammad Yousaf State Key Laboratory for Artificial Micro structures and Mes osco pic Physics Peking University Beijing School of Optics and Photo nics Beijing Institute of Technology Beijing Department of Material Science and Engineering Peking University Beijing mail ali imran pku edu cn ABSTRACT Solar energy is the most convenient and reliable energy source among all renewable energy resources and an efficient photovoltaic device is required to convert this energy into utilizable energy Different types of solar cells SC are commercially available However various parameters need to be optimized to get maximum efficiency from SC In this study we have presented SC model in which dependence of quantum efficiency QE on various parameters has been investigated The mobility of the carriers has been varied with wide range along with the carrier life time LT Results show that maximum efficiencies can be achieved up to and keeping the electron and hole mobility to be cm and cm respectively with electron and hole carrier LT to be ns and ns respectively The effect of surface recombination velocity RV has also been brought under observation and the maximum efficiency is found to be at electron and hole RV equal to be ms Results shows that the higher photovoltaic efficiencies can be achieved by increasing the mobility and carrier LT while decreasing the surface recombination velocities Keywords solar cell mobility life time recombination

Evaluation of Centralized and Distributed Micro grid Topologies Considering Power Quality Constraints Hallie Dunham Dylan Cutler Sak shi Mishra Xiang kun Lib Stanford University Serra Mall Stanford CA United States National Renewable Energy Laboratory Denver Pkwy Golden CO United States Corresponding author Dylan cutler nrel gov ABSTRACT Integration of renewable generation and energy storage technologies with conventional generation supports increased resilience lower costs and clean energy goals Traditionally energy supply needs of rural off grid communities have been addressed with diesel generation based mini grids But with increased awareness of environmental considerations and rapidly falling renewable generation costs mini grids are transforming into hybrid systems with mix of renewables energy storage and conventional generation Optimal design of an integrated energy system like hybrid mini grid requires an understanding of both the economic and power quality impacts of different designs Existing approaches to modeling distributed energy resources address the economic viability and power quality impacts via separate or loosely coupled models Here we extend RE opt techno economic optimization model developed at the National Renewable Energy Laboratory to consider both within single model RE opt formulates the design problem as mixed integer linear program that solves deterministic optimization problem for sites optimal technology mix sizing and operation to minimize life cycle cost RE opt has traditionally assumed single node system where power injection is not constrained by power quality constraints In the work presented here we expand the RE opt platform to consider multiple connected nodes In order to do this we model power flow using fixed point linear approximation method Resulting system sizes and voltage magnitudes are validated against the base RE opt model and solutions of established power flow models respectively We then use the model to explore design considerations of mini grids in Sub Saharan Africa Specifically we evaluate under what combinations of line length and line capacity it is economically beneficial or technically required based on voltage limits to build isolated mini grids versus an interconnected system that benefits from the economies of scale associated with single centralized generation system KEYWORDS centralized micro grid decentralized micro grid power quality techno economic energy modeling linear zed power flow energy economics renewable energy optimization DECLARATIONS OF INTEREST None

In nite horizon billiards Transport at the border between Gauss and vy universality classes Li or Zar faty Alexander Pe lets kyi Eli Bark and Sergey Denisov Department of Physics Institute of Nanotechnology and Advanced Materials Bar Ilan University Ramat Gan Israel Institute of Physics University of Augsburg Universit ts stra sse Augsburg Germany Department of Computer Science Oslo Metropolitan University Oslo Norway We consider transport in two billiard models the in nite horizon Lorentz gas and the stadium channel presenting analytical results for the spreading packet of particles We rst obtain the cumulative distribution function of traveling times between collisions which exhibits non analytical behavior Using renewal assumption and the vy walk model we obtain the particles probability density For the Lorentz gas it shows distinguished die rence when compared with the known Gaussian prop gator as the latter is valid only for extremely long times In particular we show plumes of particles spreading along the in nite corridors creating power law tails of the density We demonstrate the slow convergence rate via summation of independent identically distributed random variables on the border between vy and Gauss laws The renewal assumption works well for the Lorentz gas with intermediate ly sized scattering centers but fails for the stadium channel due to strong temporal correlations Our analytical results are supported with numerical sampling
