Optimal scheduling of critically loaded multi class GI queues in an alternating renewal environment ARI ARA POST THIS GUO DONG PANG AND YI ZHENG Abstract In this paper we study optimal control problems for multi class GI queues in an alternating renewal up down random environment in the Hal nW hit regime Assuming that the down times are asymptotically negligible and only the service processes are aec ted we show that the limits of the diu sion scaled state processes under non antic ip at ive preemptive work conserving scheduling policies are controlled jump diu ions driven by compound Poisson jump process We establish the asymptotic optimal it of the in nite horizon discounted and long run average ergo dic problems for the queueing dynamics Since the process counting the number of customers in each class is not Markov the usual martin gale arguments for convergence of mean empirical measures cannot be applied We surmount this obstacle by demonstrating the convergence of the generators of an augmented Markov ian model which incorporates the age processes of the renewal inter arrival times and down times We also establish long run average moment bounds of the diu sion scaled queueing processes under some mo died priority scheduling policies This is accomplished via Foster Lyapunov equations for the augmented Markov ian model

Energy Management of Airport Service Electric Vehicles to Match Renewable Generation through Rollout Approach Ren jie Wei Kang Ma Department of Electronic Electrical Engineering University of Bath Bath BA AY UK Correspondence author Kang Ma Email Ma bath ac uk Tel Abstract Traditional diesel based airport service vehicles are characterized by heavy duty high usage frequency nature and high carbon intensity per vehicle per hour Transforming these vehicles into electric vehicles would reduce CO emissions and potentially save energy costs in the context of rising fuel prices if proper energy management of airport service electric vehicles AS EV is performed To perform such an energy management this paper proposes new customized rollout approach as near optimal control method for new AS EV dynamics model which models the AS EV states their transitions over time and how control decisions affect them The rollout approach yields near optimal control strategy for the AS EV to transport luggage and to charge batteries with the objective to minimize the operation cost which in centi viz es the charging of the AS EV to match renewable generation Case studies demonstrate that the rollout approach effectively overcomes the curse of dimensionality On both typical summer and winter days the rollout algorithm results in total cost approximately less than that of the underlying greedy charging heuristic which charges battery whenever its state of charge is not the maximum The rollout algorithm is proven to be adaptive towards flight schedule changes at short notice Keywords airport service electric vehicle electric vehicle energy management heuristic control optimal control rollout algorithm

Coupled Kar hun en Lo eve and Anisotropic Sparse Grid Interpolation Method for the Probabilistic Load Flow Problem Brandon Johnson Nathan Gibson and Eduardo Co till Sanchez Oregon State University Corvallis OR USA Abstract In the traditional load ow analysis key assumption is that the input var able generator output and customer demand are ed in time and the associated response has no variability This assumption however is no longer valid as the adoption of renewable energy resources add more var ability and uncertainty to the modern electrical system Addressing these concerns is the den it ion of the Probabilistic Load Flow PL problem The challenge of the PL problem lies in handling high dimensional input uncertainties and the non linearity of the load ow equations The most straightforward way to address these problems but at the cost of com put ional time is to perform Monte Carlo method This work however solves these problems accuracy high dimensionality and computational time with coupled Kar hun en Lo eve KL expansion and Anisotropic Sparse Grid algorithm The proposed method is implemented and tested on the IEEE bus test system and modernized version of the IEEE Reliability Test System the Reliability Test System Grid Modernization Lab Cons or tiu RTS GML Results for the dimensional case show decrease in computational time when compared to the sample Monte Carlo method given bound on mean and standard deviation error Keywords Probabilistic power ow sparse grid interpolation stochastic collocation Kar hun en Lo eve expansion uncertainty quant cation

Future competitive bio energy technologies in the German heat sector Findings from an economic optimization approach Matthias Jordana Volker Lenz Markus Milling era Kat Oe hm iche nb Daniela Th rna Helmholtz Centre for Environmental Research UF Per moser stra Leipzig Germany bDB Deutsches Biomass for chung zentrum GmbH Torgau er Stra sse Leipzig Germany Abstract Meeting the de ned greenhouse gas HG reduction targets in Germany is only possible by switching to renewable technologies in the energy sector major share of that reduction needs to be covered by the heat sector which accounts for of the energy based emissions in Germany Biomass is the renewable key player in the heterogeneous heat sector today Its properties such as weather in dependency simple storage and ex ble utilization open up wide el of applications for biomass However in future heat sector full ling HG reduction targets and energy sectors being increasingly connected which bio energy technology concepts are competitive options against other renewable heating systems In this paper the cost optimal allocation of the limited German biomass potential is investigated under long term scenarios using mathematical optimization approach The model results show that bio energy can be competitive option in the future Especially the use of biomass from residues can be highly competitive in hybrid combined heat and power CHP pellet combustion plants in the private household sector However towards wood based biomass use in high temperature industry applications is found to be the most cost ec ent way to reduce heat based emissions by in Keywords heat sector bio energy renewable energy optimization hybrid heat technologies
